sense.definition: (neut. v.) to stand forth, project; to be cut in relief, opp. שקע to sink, be engraven.
sense.notes: R. Hash. 24 b טבעת שחותמה בֹּולֵט Ms. M. (ed. incorr.) a ring whose seal is cut in relief; Y. Ab. Zar. III, 42 c bot. Gitt. 20 a sq. Sot. III, 4 עיניה בֹולְטֹות her eyes protruded; Num. R. s. 9.—Yoma 54 a דוחקין ובולטין pressing forth and protruding (from behind the curtain); a. fr.
Y. Sabb. XII, 13 d בבולט מקום הכתב וכ' when he beats out the place of writing, opp. חוקק.
Part. pass. בָּלִיט. Targ. II Chr. V, 9. Ḥull. 45 b בְּלִיטָן, ib. 76 a בְּלִיטֵי protruding sinews, opp. בלועי sunk in the flesh, indistinguishable.

, read בַּבֹּושָׁרֹות. Cant. R. to II, 15 קיניגין מכללה ודיארטיה עתידים מן ב' דא דיחתו וייטורד זה שטיחם אחריהם, read, acc. to intimation in comment. Mat. K., as follows: קיניגין ותייטרן הה"ד מוציא אסירים בכשרות ואח"כ התייטרון זה שנ' הבאים אחריהם בים (the passage through the Red Sea and the coming of the noble Egyptians afterwards was) like the order of the kynegion (the actors in the fights of the arena) and the theatron (the spectators), as it says (Ps. LXVIII, 7), ‘He leadeth forth the captives with their outfits’, and then come the spectators, as we read (Ex. XIV, 28), ‘who came after them into the Sea.’
, Y. Ned. III, 38 a top, v. בריכסון.—Pesik. Baḥod. p. 107 b, v. כִּילִי.

sense.definition: , v. בלל; cmp. נבל) to be crumbled; to be worn out, to fail, decay, perish.
sense.notes: Koh. R. to I, 4 הוא בֹולֶה it (the generation of man) decays (dies out), אינה בֹולָה it (the earth) does not grow old. Taan. 9 a (play on עד בלי די Mal. III, 10) עד שיִבְלוּ שפתותיכם מלומר די until your lips grow tired from saying, It is enough; (Y. ib. III, 66 d bot. שיבללו, v. בָּלַל); a. fr.—Part. pass. בָּלוּי outworn. Pl. בְּלוּיִים. Midr. Till. to Ps. XXV, 1.

Lev. R. s. 4 הנפש מְבַלָּה וכ' the soul survives the body. Ib. s. 19 (play on אין בלתך, I Sam. II, 2) אין לְבַלֹּותֶךָ there is none to outlive thee. Koh. R. l. c.; Cant. R. to V, 15 one erects a building ואחר מְבַלֶּה אותו (not מכלה) and another man ruins it. Snh. 105 a, v. בִּלְעָם.

נִתְבַּלָּה to become outworn, fade away. Esth. R. introd. עתידין לְהִבָּלֹות (Gen. R. s. 42 לִבְלֹות) are destined to decay. Deut. R. s. 7, end נִתְבַּלּוּ (the garments) were worn out. B. Mets. 87 a נ' הבשר her body was withered. B. Bath. 146 a עשויין לִיבָּלֹות made to be used up.

Targ. Deut. VIII, 4; ib. Y. XXIX, 4 בלמו, Var. כלמו, read בלת; a. fr.—Lev. R. s. 19 כולו בלה all goes to ruin. Ber. 5 b, v. בְּכָא. Ib. 6 a. Bekh. 9 a ובלו להו ואזול they failed and went to destruction. Ab. V, 22 סיב ובְלֵה בה grow old and frail in it (the study of the Law).—[Targ. Ps. LXII, 11; XCI, 2 Ms., v. כְּלִי I.]

Is. III, 15; a. e.—Ab. Zar. 20 a that this beauty ב' עפרא dust will destroy.—Part. pass. f. מְבַלְּיָא. Lev. R. s. 33 (interpret. בלה נאפים Ezek. XXIII, 43) Aquila translates παλαιὰ πόρνη (old harlot), דהוא מבליא גייארא ed. (Ar. דהיא מב' גיירייא, Yalk. Dan. 1061 only דהיא מבליא) which means, a wasted harlot (wasted through fornication).
(preced., cmp. בְּלָאֹות, בְּלֹויִים) rotten pieces of (wood). Targ. Is. XLIV, 19 (h. text בּוּל, v. Rashi a. l.; Var. יִבְלֵי).

Gitt. 57 a עד דמתחזי ב' וכ' so that the stone of a ring could be distinguished (as to shape, legend &c.) at a distance of a mile (from the illuminated town). Ib. 58 a נקטי ב' וכ' (Yalk. Lam. 1242 כיליינא, כול') they took an amulet (believed to effect the begetting of healthy and handsome children).

III, 2 זו בְּלִילָתָהּ עבה וכ' the one forms a thick mixture (one Log of oil to one Issaron of flour), the other forms a loose mixture (three Log to one Issaron).— Pl. בְּלִילוֹת. Tosef. Dem. II, 7; Men. 18 b; Ḥull. 132 b הב' the priest’s mixing the offerings (Lev. II, 5; a. fr.).
part. pass. of בְּלַם.

sense.definition: v. בְּלִי) [ nothing,] air (fr. Job XXVI, 7).
sense.notes: Num. R. s. 14 עשר ספירות ב' (some ed. בלי מה) the ten heavenly spheres (cmp. Sepher Yetsir. beg.). Ex. R. s. 15 על אויר העולם על ב' … he rested it (the upper story, the sky) on the atmosphere, on b’limah (Tanḥ. Ḥaye 3 על מה על האויר).
, Pesik. R. s. 42, read כָּלִינוֹס.
, v. בַּלְנֵי
, Y. Snh. X, 29 a top, read כְּלִינִידִין.
, v. בַּלִּיסְטָרִי
, Cant. R. to II, 14, read כלִיסְטִין; cmp. Ex. R. s. 21.

sense.definition: (ballistra, βάλιστρα) catapult, a war engine for throwing stones, or (b. manualis) for arrows.
sense.notes: Lam. R. to II, 2 אבני ב' stones thrown from the catapult. Y. Sot. VIII, 22 b bot. ברד כנגד בליצטורא שלהן; (Mekh. Bshall. s. 2 בלסטראות, pl.; Yalk. Ex. 232 בלסיטראות, read בליסט') the hail stones correspond to the catapults in the warfare of men. Pesik. R. s. 17; Pesik. Vayhi p. 67 a אבני בלסתרא (corr. acc.). Pesik. R. s. 29—30 (p. 139 b ed. Fr.) את האבן בליסטרה (read אבן הבל'). Lam. R. introd. (R. Josh. 2) אבני בליסטרוס (read … רא); a. fr.— Pl. בַּלִּיסְטְרָאוֹת. Yalk. l. c., v. supra. Tanḥ. Bo 4; Shof’tim 14. Mekh. l. c. Midr. Till. to Ps. XVIII.

sense.definition: (ballistarius, βαλιστάριος) attendant of the catapult, also archer.
sense.notes: Ḥull. 60 b או ב' היה … was Moses a hunter or an archer (to have known the nature of animals so well)?
Num. R. s. 14 (play on בֶּלַע Gen. XXXVI, 3

sense.definition: he sold his birthright בשביל בְּלִיעָתוֹ to satisfy his gluttony.
sense.notes: —בית הב' œsophagus. Toh. I, 1; a. fr.—2) vortex, v. בְּלוּעָה.

sense.definition: (= h. בית הבליעה, v. preced.) gullet, whence (cmp. וֶשֶׁט) straits (prob. Scylla and Charybdis).
sense.notes: Bekh. 9 a.—Snh. 110 c בלועי דקרח (corr. acc.) the chasm created for Korah.
Snh. 111 b (playing on עוֹל) בני ב' means בנים … עול וכ' sons who shook off the yoke &c.

sense.definition: (= h. בְּלִיעָה) swallowing, Targ. Y. I Num. XXVI, 11, constr.
sense.notes: בְּלִיעַת.
, v. בַּלִּיסְטְרָא
, v. כַּלְקִיס
Sabb. 134 a. Ḥull. 8 b ב' דפרסא a shred of a curtain (soft rag). Kidd. 48 b צייר בב' tied up in a rag.— Pl. בְּלִיָּיתָא. Yeb. 120 a (some ed. בליתא).

sense.definition: sec. r. of בול, ביל; √בו, בה, cmp. בִּין, to penetrate, break through, v. בלט; b) √בל to crumble, soften, cmp. √מל; v. בלי, נבל, בלט in בולטיתא) to mix (with oil), knead, stir; to mix fodder.
sense.notes: Zeb. XIV, 3 (112 b) הבּוֹלֵל the priest who kneads the meat-offering with oil, v. בְּלִילָה. Dem. V, 5 בולל ונוטל (strike out ואוכל in Bab. ed., Ar. Var. בורר) he mixes the fruits and takes the tithe. Y. B. Kam. IV, beg. 4 a לִבְלֹול to mix up (coins in a bag.) Y. R. Hash. I, 56 d bot.; Tanḥ. Noah 11, v. בּוּל III; a. fr.—Part. pass. בָּלוּל, f. בְּלוּלָה. Snh. 24 a (play on בבל) ב' במקרא וכ' mixed up (confused) in Bible study &c. [Y. Yeb. VIII, end, 9 d קריבה בבלל, read בכָלִיל.] V. בָּלוּל.

הוּבְלָל to be mixed. Y. Maas. Sh. II, 53 c, v. חָפַן. Men. XII, 4 (103 b; 18 b) ששים נבללין sixty measures of flour can be thoroughly mixed; v. בִּילָה. Ib. יכולים לְהִבָּלֵל.—Y. Shek. VI, 49 d bot. אש מוּבְלָלָה באש fire mixed with fire.—[Y. Taan. III, 66 d bot. עד שיִבָּלֲלוּ וכ' until your speech shall become confounded from repeatedly saying, Enough; v. בלי.] Y. Ber. VI, 10 a top (play on בַּל) יִבָּלֲלוּ וכ' all blessings shall be kneaded thogether— Pilp. בִּלְבֵּל.

sense.definition: , fodder-bag, nose-bag, muzzle) to muzzle, restrain.
sense.notes: Yalk. Num. 743 (read in place of כדו בלום וכ':) פיו בָּלוּם לעמו של משה יכול הוא לִבְלֹום צפורנו של אחד מהם the mouth of the people of Moses is tied up (we dare not talk), but can he tie up (disable) the nail of any of them (the Canaanites)? Ḥull. 89 a (play on בלימה, Job XXVI, 7) שבּוֹלֵם וכ' who restrains himself in strife (refrains from violence, keeps silence &c.).—2) part. pass. בָּלוּם (cmp. אִלֵּם) unfit for use, lame, sore, swollen, closed by a tumor. Bekh. 40 b פיו ב' one whose mouth is swollen (one opin. in Rashi: shrunk); רגליו מְבוּלָּמוֹת (Pu.) one whose feet are swollen (shrunk). Ib. 43 b חוטמו ב' Ar. (ed. בולם, corr. acc.) whose nose is obstructed.—Gitt. 67 a אוצר ב' a packed treasury of knowledge; v. בָּלַס.— Part. Pu. מְבוּלָּם, v. supra.

sense.definition: to restrict … Y. Ḥag. II, 78 a bot. ובלבד שיַבְלִים לעיסתו provided that (when cutting &c.) he does only as much as is needed for his dough for the offering; [Tosaf.
sense.notes: to Ḥag. 17 b, s. v. אלא, cites שיכלה עיסתו, v. כָּלָה.]

sense.definition: (v. preced.; cmp. Syr. בלמא halter) to attempt to get rid of the halter; to kick, strike (of an unruly horse).
sense.notes: Pesik. Zakh. p. 24 b (ref. to Ps. XXXII, 9) thou puttest a bit on him והוא בוֹלֵם and he strikes. Ib. קריב לגביה והוא ב' (strike out לא, as Tanḥ. ed. Bub. Ki Thetse, 6 a. Yalk. Ps. 719) you come near him and he strikes; Tanḥ. Ki Thetse, 6; Yalk. Deut. 938, Ps. l. c. (with var. vers.).
I.
Targ. Is. XXXII, 4; a. e. [Targ. Y. Deut. XXIX, 4; v. בְּלֵי I.]

sense.definition: (cmp. כרך) to put meat between bread, wrap up.
sense.notes: Ḥull. 107 b ב' ליה אומצא wrapped up a piece of meat for him (v. Tosaf. a. l.).

sense.definition: (preced.; v. בָּלַם) halter, trnsf. guard, protection of the borders of a field, as fences &c.; cmp. אַפְסָרָא.
sense.notes: B. Mets. 103 b כל עיקר ב' וכ' whatever is essential for guarding the limits, the landlord must provide. [Ms. M. כלומ', Ar. כלמי, v. כְּלָמָא.]

sense.definition: (βαλανεύς) bathing master, bathing attendant (who receives a small coin as fee, cmp. אוֹלְיָיר).
sense.notes: Shebi. VIII, 5; v. בַּיָּיר. Y. B. Bath. IV, 14 c bot. מקום הב' the bathing master’s station (the income therefrom); a. fr.— Pl. כַּלָּנִין. Sabb. IV, 2 קורות הב' the beams whereon the bathing masters are stationed.
Lev. R. s. 28 אזל בדיל ב' he went after a bather. Ib. אתעביד ב' וספר has become a bather and hair cutter; Esth. R. to VI, 10 (בלן); Pesik. R. s. 18.
, Sifra B’har Par. 5, ch. VII (Yalk. Lev. 666 בגלטקא), v. לֶקְטִיקָא a. גְּלוּגְדְּקָא.

Y. Ber. VI, 10 c bot. כהדין דשתי חמרא בתר בילני (read בליני) as if one drinks wine after bathing (for medicinal purposes, when the wine which he drinks after meal cannot be considered as a continuation of the draught taken before meal; v. אֲלוּנְטִית II). Y. Maas. Sh. IV, 54 d bot. as much as one will ask (for the fruits left over) on a hot summer day בתר ב' after bathing time (when he is anxious to sell).—*Denom. בַּלָּנִיּוֹת f. pl. (= balnearia) bathing apparel. B. Bath. IV, 5 (67 b, Bab. ed.) ואת הב' (Var. וִילָאוֹת q. v.).
, Y. Sabb. VI, 8 b bot., transl. of רעלות Is. III, 19, read כְּלָנִידְיָיא.

(בַּלְרֵי) בַּלְנְרֵי m. pl. (balnearia) bathing apparel, bathing utensils. Y. Kil. IX, 32 a bot.; Y. M. Kat. III, 82 a ב' נשים women’s bathing clothes; Sabb. 147 b בלרי (some ed. בלורי, corr. בלנ'); Tosef. Kil. V, 16 בלארי (corr. acc.).
—V. בַּנְּרִיּוֹת.

definition.italic: to mix with all sorts of things, to mix indiscriminately.

sense.notes: Part. pass. בָּלוּס, f. בְּלוּסָה. Sabb. 76 b עיסה ב' a dough of unsifted flour (with bran &c.). B. Bath. 58 a אוצר ב' a store room of mixed things (lumber room).—Gitt. 67 a אוצר ב' a mind full of all kind of knowledge (oth. vers. בלום, v. בָּלַם).— Pl. בְּלוּסִין. Mikv. IX, 5 הב' utensils soaked with a mixture of colors (stains from use), opp. נקיים shining, polished.
Gen. R. s. 28 אוצרות בְּלוּסִים store of spoiled fruits.
, v. בְּלַסְפֵימְיָא

sense.definition: (בסם, with inserted ל = ר; hence βάλσαμον which was readopted as בלסמון; cmp. בְּלוּזְמָא) balsam, aromatic gum.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 91 (interpr. צרי) בלסם קטף the gum of the balsam tree.—Targ. Cant. VII, 14. Lev. R. s. 31; Cant. R. to I, 15; a. e. Cmp. פַּלְסְמוֹן a. אַפַּרְסָמוֹן.
Y’lamd. to Num. XXVIII, quot. (בליספ') in Ar.—Tanḥ. ed. Bub. Tol’doth 21 בלסימיה (corr. acc.).
Y’lamd., ref. to I Kings XXI, 13 quot. in Ar. (interpret. בֵּרַךְ).
, v. בַּלִּיסְטְרָא

sense.definition: , v. בלל) to absorb, opp. פלט; to swallow, consume.
sense.notes: Y. Shek. VI, 49 c bot.… שהאור בּוֹלֵעַ בּוֹלַעַת … בּוֹלְעִין the flame absorbs a portion of the oil, and so do the wood and the kettle. Ḥull. 110 b the liver when boiled with other meat פולטת ואינה ב' gives out (blood) but absorbs nothing from the other pieces. Y. Sabb. XIV, 14 d top; Tosef. ib. XII (XIII), 9 but he may sip vinegar ובוֹלֵעַ and swallow it (opp. פלט to spit it out). Y. Ter. VIII, 45 b bot. הלעוס כבָלוּעַ what is chewed is to be considered as swallowed. Ḥull. 71 a טומאה בְלוּעָה an unclean object (food) that has been swallowed.—Snh. 110 a הַבְּלוּעִין those (of the band of Korah) that were swallowed up. Kel. IX, 6, v. דָּֽרְבָן; a. fr.

sense.definition: to be swallowed; with בין, to be absorbed, disappear.
sense.notes: Sot. 36 b; Tanḥ. Vayigg. 4; Yalk. Gen. 150 (interpret. the name Bela, Gen. XLVI, 2
שנ' בין האומות for he (Joseph) has disappeared among gentiles. Gen. R. s. 94; Yalk. l. c. שנבלע ממני he disappeared to me.

sense.definition: to cause swallowing, to make absorb.
sense.notes: Ex. R. s. 33 הִבְלַעְתָּ לקרה thou mad’st (the earth) swallow Korah. Ber. 24 b מַבְלִיעוֹ בטליתו he hides the spittle in his cloak; Y. Sabb. VII, 10 b top. Ḥull. 113 a מַבְ' דם באברים causes the blood to remain in the meat (prevents it from flowing out).—Trnsf. to sell something in connection with other things, in a lump, in the bargain. Bekh. 31 b מבליעו וכ' he sells it (the meat) in the bargain with the hide &c. B. Mets. 64 a; B. Kam. 118 b one who robs his neighbor וה' לו בחשבון and makes up for it implicitly on settling his accounts. V. הַבְלָעָה.

sense.definition: to be swallowed up; to mingle with, v. supra Nif.—Part.
sense.notes: מוּבְלַע. Ber. 31 b מ' בין אנשים mixing with people, expl. לא ארוך וכ' neither very tall &c. (of average qualities). Erub. IV, 6 מ' ביניהן his property is enclosed between theirs (reaches into the limits of each). Y. ib. IV, 21 d bot. עיירות המוּבְלָעוֹת inland-towns, opp. border-towns. Y. B. Bath. VII, 15 cd מוּבְלָעִין בה fields which are enclosed by others belonging to the same estate.

sense.definition: to be swallowed up, to disappear.
sense.notes: Midr. Till. to Ps. XIX, beg. מִתְבַּלֵּעַ מן וכ' he disappears from the world (forfeits his life).

Targ. Ex. VII, 12; a. fr.—Ḥull. 111 a כי היכי דפליט הדר ב' as it gives out, so does it again absorb; a. fr.—Part. pass. בְּלִיעַ, בְּלִיעָא. Ib. בליעא דמא filled with blood.—Snh. 110 a בלועי דקרח, v. בְּלִיעֵי.— Trnsf. to receive blows (cmp. סָפַג). Men. 7 a קולפי טאבי בַּלְעִי וכ' I received many blows at the hands of Ab. over &c. Arakh. 22 a. Ber. 56 a.—Targ. II, Esth. III, 7 בְּלִיעָן אינון בידי they are swallowed up (bound to be destroyed) by my hand.
, as h. Hif. Ḥull. 67 b אַבְלַע לי let me swallow them (put them in my mouth). Men. 17 a, v. infra. B. Mets. 64 a וא' ליה בחשבון, v. preced. Hif.

sense.definition: to be swallowed up, to disappear.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Gen. XLVI, 21 אתב' מניה he was swallowed up (disappeared) from his side; v. preced. Targ. Josh. VI, 5 יתבלע וכ' shall sink into the ground beneath it; a. e.—Y. R. Hash. II, 58 a bot. איתב' מן קומוי (the moon) disappeared from his sight.

sense.definition: to be given to eat; trnsf. to be taught.
sense.notes: Ber. 24 b הא מילתא אִבְלְעָא לי בי וכ' v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) this I have been taught in the school of R. &c.; (Men. 17 a הא מילתא אבלע לי וכ' this has R. Ḥ. taught me).
B. Mets. III, 8 (40 a) לוג ומחצה ב' a Log and a half is a reasonable leakage (absorbed by new vessels); a. e.

sense.definition: pr. n. m. (b. h.) Bela; v. בָּלַע a. בְּלִיעָה.
בֶּלַע or בַּלַּע (cmp. בְּלִי) a nothing, a mote.
sense.notes: Tanḥ. Vayak. 7 (ref. to כְּבַלַּע Num. IV, 20) כב' הזה שהוא נופל בעין; (Num. R. s. 5 מן העין) as much as a mote which enters one’s eye.
Num. R. s. 14; v. בְּלִיעָה. Snh. 105 a, v. בִּלְעָם.

sense.definition: ch. m. (cmp. בֶּלַע) the thing swallowed, choking fit.
sense.notes: Y. Ab. Zar. II, 40 d אהן בלעה שרי in a choking attack it is allowed (to apply remedies on the Sabbath) Ib. הוה ליה בלע had a choking fit; Koh. R. to X, 5 הוה ליה חד בלעא. Ib. לאפקא בִלְעֵיה to get out what he had swallowed.
, Y. Dem. III, 23 b מחוסר לב', read בְּעָלִין = בְּעָלִים, v. בַּעַל

sense.definition: (b. h.) pr. n. m. Balaam, the gentile prophet of the Pentateuch.
sense.notes: Snh. 105 a ב' בַּלַּע עם Ar. (Var. in Ar., a. ed. בַּלָּא) devourer (destroyer) of the people; other homilet. etymology ibid. שבִּלָּה עם he ruined the people (through debauchery; Rashi: = בִּלְבֵּל). Gen. R. s. 65. Ab. V, 19 (as type of false teachers); a. fr.
Y. Ter. VIII, 46 a ואיתכ', ואיתכלעסון (corr. acc.).
Ex. R. s. 29 שאל ב' את ר' עקיבא [prob. to be be read אל' ז"ל = אליהו ז"ל, cmp. Y. Ber. IX, 13 c; Midr. Till. to Ps. XVIII; CIV end].
, v. בִּילָּק

sense.definition: (b. h.) pr. n. m. Balak, King of Moab.
sense.notes: Ber. 7 a. Num. R. s. 20; a. fr.
…, v. כּוֹלֶּקְטָר (collectarius), and כַּלַּקְטֵירִין (χαρακτῆρες).
, v. גְּלַבְקְיָא
, v. בּוּלְרָא
, v. בַּלְנְרִין
, v. בלרין
, v. בְּלוּרִית

sense.definition: , Ab. Zar. 18 b ב' ובלריון Ms. M. (ed. only בלורין; Y. ib.
sense.notes: I, 40 a מילרין מילריה, added in Ms. M. l. c. as מלרין ומלריון; Yalk. Ps. 613 בלרין ובלריין) corruption of לִיבְּרָלִין (liberales, sub. ludi, or liberalia) Bacchanalian games (v. Sm. Ant. s. v. Dionysia). [The preceding לוליון or לולין must prob. be read לודין ludi.] V. סגולרין.

sense.definition: * to hack and break the clods of earth (v. בּוּל II; v. Sm. Ant. s. v. Raster).
sense.notes: Lev. R. s. 36 on setting a vine בּוֹלְשִׁין אותה וכ' (read אותן) you first break them (the large stony clods) under it and then you plant it. Cmp. אַבְלֹושָׁא.

sense.definition: (law) to search (for concealed goods &c.) to hold a visitation.
sense.notes: Denom. בַּלְשִׁי &c.
Midd. I, 7 לִבְלֹושׁ וכ' to patrol the Temple.
Targ. O. Gen. XXXI, 35; a. fr.
same. Targ. Is. XXII, 5 מְבַלְּשִׁין (ed. Vien. מַבְלְשִׁין Af.); a. e.
Targ. Ob. v. 6, quot. B. Kam. 3 b; a. e.

Nidd. 52 a שדר ב' וכ' he sent a constable and forced her to leave her (second) husband.— Pl. בָּלֹושִׁין, בָּלֹושַׁיָּיא. Targ. Zeph. I, 12; a. e.—Ber. 44 a בָּלוֹשֵׁי Ar. a. Ms. F. (ed. בָּאלֹושֵׁי).

Y. Dem. VII, 26 a מקל ב' (not מיקל) the commissioner’s pointed staff (with which he searches). Y’lamd. to Gen. XXXVIII, 1 quot. in Ar. בלשיי מסר וכ' the constable delivers the prisoner over to the executioner.— Pl. בַּלְשִׁין. Kel. XV, 4 מקל הב', v. supra.—בַּלְשִׁיִּין. Y’lamd. to Num. XXIII, 7. [Var. in Hai Gaon בַּלְסַיי.]

sense.definition: Belshafat (contr. of בי אלישפט), a staple town in Susiana (Khazistan), Syriac name Beth-Lapetha = Ahwaz (Neub. Géogr. p. 380).
sense.notes: Taan. 22 a בי לפט ed. (Var. בילפט, בולשפטי, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 8). B. Mets. 73 b זולשפט ed. (Ar. לולשפט, Ms. H. בלשפט); B. Bath. 98 a וול שפט ed. (Ar. לולש'; Ms. M. ולשפט; Var. ויל שפט, וילש', לישפט, בי לישפט, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note). [Yoḥãsin s. v. ברוקא: בי אלישפט.]

Bets. 21 a; Tosef. ib. II, 6. Ab. Zar. V, 6 (Y. ed. בו'). Y. ib. 45 a top בשלום בו' ובמלחמת בו' the Mishnah means when the troop comes in peace, or when it comes with hostility. Sabb. 145 b ed. בו', Ar. בל'.
R. Hash. II, 4 (22 b; Ms. M. בילתי, בלתי; v. Rabb. D. S. c. l. note). Ib. 23 a bot. מאי בית ב' (Ms. M. 1 בילתי, 2 בלחי, Ms. L. בילתין) what is B. B.? Answ. בירם.

sense.definition: , Y. R. Hash. I, 57 b, כהדא ב', prob. to be read: כהדין אִיפוֹמְנִימָטִין (ὑπομνήματα) like the minutes of the court proceedings, opp. to preced. דירין, read דִּיקִין (δίκη, pl.).
the fourth book of Moses ( Numeri).
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 3; a. e.—ב' רבה the fourth book of Midrash Rabbah (Num. R.).

sense.definition: entrance, gathering place, ascent (cmp. b. h. מָבוֹא a. מַעֲלֶה); esp. Bamah, name of the legitimate altars prior to, and of the illegitimate after, the establishment of a central sanctuary (at Shiloh) and of the Temple at Jerusalem; temporary or improvised altar ; v. Zeb. XIV, 4—8.
sense.notes: —Meg. I, 10 ב' גדולה national altar; ב' קטנה local altar (during their period of legitimacy); Tosef. Zeb. XIII, 17 sq.; a. fr.— Pl. בָּמוֹת Zeb. l. c. Ib. 114 b בשעת היתר הב' at the period when bamoth were permitted. v. supra; a. fr. [Meg. 32 a הלוחות והב', v. בִּימָה.] Cmp. בִּימָה.
, v. בָּמָסָא
, v. בָּמְתָא
, Midr. Thron. Salom., Beth-Hammidr. ed. Jellinek V, 2, read בָּימוֹסָאוֹת, v. בִּימוֹס
[Targ. Y. II, Deut. XXXII, 13 בַּמְסָא, read בָּמָתָא.]— Pl. בָּמָסַיָּא, בָּמוֹסִין, בָּמוֹסַיָּא (בַּמְסַיָּא) idolatrous places of worship. Targ. II Chr. XIV, 4; a. e.
, Cant. R. to VII, 10 some ed., read ככּוֹמֶר הזה.
Targ. I Kings III, 4; a. e.— Pl. (בָּמוֹתָא) בָּמָתָא. Targ. ib. 2; a. e.—[Targ. II Chr. XI, 15 בָּמָתַיָּיא.]

בֶּן (b. h.; בנה) offspring, son, child. שבוע הב' the male child’s week, a disguise for circumcision day, adopted during the Hadrianic persecutions. Snh. 32 b; Y. Keth. I, 25 c; a. e.—ישוע הב' a disguise for פִּדְיוֹן הבן. B. Kam. 80 a.—… בְּנוֹ של the son of, v. שֶׁל. בְּנָן של קדושים descendant of holy men. Ab. Zar. 50 a; a. e.— Pl. בָּנִים, constr. בְּנֵי. Ab. III, 14 ב' למקום chosen children of God. Gen. R. s. 82 בָּנֶיהָ של תורה children (followers) of the Law.—Trnsf. belonging to, fit for &c.; e.g. בני גולה those belonging to the colony of exiles, Babylonians &c.; בני גליל Galileans; בני אכילה things fit to be eaten &c. [For such compounds as are not self-evident, see the respective determinants.] [בני פיקרין, v. בְּנִיפיקָרִין.]
, v. בני
Targ. II, Esth. VI, 12 Ms. (ed. בַּאנְיָא).
pr. n. m., v. בַּנַּאי II

B. Mets. 118 b; a. fr.—Y. Ḥag. II, 77 b top אומנתיה דהן ב' this boy’s trade should be that of a builder. Sabb. 156 b ב' וסתיר וכ' (shall grow to be one) who builds and destroys, destroys and builds (restless). Ib. 115 a; a. fr. V. אַרְרִּיכָל.—[V. בַּנָּאִים, בַּנָּאִין.]

sense.definition: (= רב ב') pr. n. m. Bannai, Bannaah, Rabbannai, name of an Amora.
sense.notes: Keth. 50 b. Ber. 38 b. [Ib. 55 b Ms. M. נהוראי. B. Mets. 2 a, a. e. רב', Ms. M. רבינא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note.]

a. pl. (contr. of בן נאים, v. נָאֶה) one of becoming conduct, refined, a cultured person ; opp. בּוֹר; (cmp. Sabb. 114 a top, as to a scholar’s duty to pay attention to dress). [For oth. opin., v. Sachs Beitr. II, 199; Frankel Monatsschr. 1846, p. 855.] Mikv. IX, 6; Sabb. l. c. של ב' וכ' the garments of a Bannaïm, if stained with pitch on one side cannot be immersed for levitical purposes before the stain is removed (because their owner is more fastidious). Tosef. Mikv. VI (VII), 14 (where גדולה a. קטנה refer to the stain; as to correct vers. v. R. S. to Mikv. l. c.). Sabb. l. c. מאי ב' what does B. mean? Answer: אלו וכ' it means the scholars who are engaged in building up the world (of civilization) all their lives (as if fr. בָּנָה). Ib. (dresses of the B.) אלו כלים וכ' are the court-garments imported &c., v. אוֹלָרִין.
, v. בִּנְיָיתָא
, pl. of בְּרַתָּא.
. Yoma 10 a ב' ביר וכ' shall the builders (of the Temple, the Persians) be delivered into the hands of the destroyers (the Romans)?
pl. of בַּת.

Sabb. XII, 1 הַבּוֹנֶה he who builds (on the Sabbath). Ib.] 102 b משום בונה (isguilty) because it is one of the labors classified under ‘building’; a. fr.—Metaph. to educate, train. Ber. 64 a (ref. to Is. LIV, 93) א"ת בָּנַיִךְ אלא בוֹנַיִּךְ read not banayikh (thy children), but bonayikh (thy builders, trainers); v. בַּנָּאִים.—Ex. R. s. 23 (play on b’noth, Cant. I, 5) בּוֹנוֹת וכ' the authorities directing the building of Jerusalem; v. Pi.—Ḥull. 78 b זה בנה אב, v. אָב, a. בִּנְיָן. [Tosef. Par. VII (VI), 4 בְּנָאוֹ ed. Zuck., v. כָּנַן.]
Y. B. Bath. III, 14 b, a. fr. לְהִיבָּנוֹת, לִיבָּנוֹת.
Gen. R. s. 71.

sense.definition: (denom. of בֵּן) to be adopted, naturalized.
sense.notes: Pesik. R. s. 43 נִתְבַּנּוּ בישראל they became full Israelitish citizens.

sense.definition: to lay out, plan a city, determine its limits.
sense.notes: Ex. R. l. c. the Great Sanedrin held sessions ומְבַנָּים אותה (not אותם) and determined the limits of Jerusalem; v. Snh. I, 5.—Part. Pu. מְבוּנֶּה cultivated; built (of human stature), well-proportioned. Keth. 112 a; Sot. 34 b היתה מְבוּנָּה על וכ' it (Hebron, in spite of the rocky nature of its soil) was seven times better cultivated than Zoan (one measure of its land yielding as much as did seven measures of the soil of Zoan). Ib. 42 b (play on benayim, I Sam. XVII, 4) מב' מכל מום his build was without blemish.
, v. בֵּינֹונִי
ch. = h. בָּנָה. Targ. Deut. XXV, 9 (Y. יִבְנֶה); a. fr.—Part. בָּנֵי. Targ. Gen. IV, 17.—M. Kat. 10 b מִיבְנֵי to erect; a. e.
as h. Nif.
a. 2). Targ. I Kings III, 2; a. fr.—Targ. Gen. XVI, 2; a. e.—Y. Ber. II, 5 a מִתְבַּנְיֵי will be rebuilt; a. e.
, v. בִּנְיָיתָא

sense.definition: pl. (benignae, sub. interpretationes, opp. durae, v. Harper’s Lat. Dict. 188

sense.notes: Ab. Zar. 4 a אבקש ב' שלהם ed. (Ms. בנו'; Ar. בנינגי, taking ב for a servile letter as do the commentaries) I shall search for what can be found in their favor.
Y. Yoma III, 40 c; Y. Gitt. VII, 48 d bot.; Y. B. Bath. VIII, 16 c top ב' דאורייתא a builder of the law (forming ingenious conclusions).— Pl. בַּנָּיִין. Y. Ber. IX, 13 a top; v. אוּמַן.
Y. Peah I, 15 b bot.; a. fr. (Bab. B. Bath. 57 b בַּנָּאָה, v. בַּנַּאי II).
, v. בֵּין
, v. בִּנְיָנָא
, Y. Shek. VI, 49 d top, v. בֵּינוֹנִי

sense.definition: (בני; cmp. ארב, ארג a. denom.) net-work, veils, curtains &c. Ber. 61 a; Sabb. 95 a; Erub. 18 a; Nidd. 45 b שכן בכרכי הים קורין לקלעייתא ב' (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. for vers.) at the sea-towns they call all net-works binyatha; Koh. R. to VII, 2 בִּנְיָאתָא (Var. בנאיתא).

sense.notes: Succ. 51 b מי שלא ראה בה"מ בבִנְיָנוֹ whoever has not seen the Temple in its finished state, expl. ibid. בִּנְיַן הורדוס the Herodian Temple (Ms. M. … ראה בנין בה"מ; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).—אַמַּת הב', v. אַמָּה.—Sabb. 102 b דרך ב' בכן such kind of labor belongs to builders’ work. Ib. דמי לב' it looks like builders’ work; a. fr.—בִּנְיַן אב standard rule, v. אָב; v. Ḥull. 78 b, B. Kam. 77 b זה בנה אב this (Ex. XII, 5) forms the rule, wherever שה is used &c. (v. Tosaf. a. l.).—Sabb. 114 a בִּנְיָנוֹ של עולם the preservation of the (mental and moral) world.
Ohol. II, 1 רוב בניינו the greater portion of a corpse as to size of limbs, contrad. to רוב מניינו the larger as to the number of joints and limbs.
Targ. Koh. III, 3; a. e.
Pl. בְּנִיסִין; f. בְּנִיסָתָא. Targ. Y. Gen. XL, 6 (O. נסיסין). Targ. Prov. XXV, 23. [Y. Shek. IV, 48 b bot. בניסין, read: בֵּינֵיהוֹן, v. בֵּין ch.]
, Y. Keth. XII, 35 a תמני … ב', v. כְּנִישָׁא

the rights of a privileged person concerning the protection of his character. Tanḥ. Korah (ed. Bub.) addit. 2 (cmp. Tanḥ. ib. 8) משל לשושבינה של בת המלך שביקש בני פיקון מן המלך (corr. acc.) this is to be compared to a sponsor of the King’s daughter who claimed satisfaction of the King on the ground of his privileges. He said to the King אם אינך תובע ב' שלי if thou wilt not stand up for my privileges &c.; Num. R. s. 18 בנפקין שלך (corr. acc.).
Sifrè Deut. 317 (בני פיקרין, בני פוקרים corr. acc.); Yalk. Deut. 944 אלו ב' שלהם those are their (the Roman) beneficiarii.
, v. בִּנְיָיתָא

sense.definition: (√בך, v. בכי) cavities dug around the vine to receive the water, = h. בָּדִיד 2).
sense.notes: M. Kat. 4 b
pl., v. בְּרַתָּא.—[V. also בֵּן.]

sense.definition: (sec. r. of בס, v. בסם) to ferment, get sour ; trnsf. to be angry, agitated.
sense.notes: Dan. II, 12. Targ. Y. Gen. XL, 2. Targ. Esth. II, 21 בנסו וקצפו (ed. Vien. כְּנַסּוּ, corr. acc.). Ib. IV, 17 ונסס וב' (ed. Vien. וכ', corr. acc., h. text ויעבר!); v. נְסַס.—Part. pass. בְּנִיס, v. בְּנִיסָא. Denom. בַּסִּין.
Targ. Job XVI, 10 (Ms. כנסא, some ed. בַּנָּסָא).
, v. בְּנִיפִיקִין

sense.definition: (= בלנרין; cmp. βανίαριν for βαλνιαρία, S.) bathing apparel.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 45 דליים וב' וכ' (Ar. כנריות, some ed. פנדיות) buckets and bathing apparel did she make her carry &c.; Yalk. Gen. 79 סנדלריאות (corr. acc.).
Y. B. Kam. VII, end 6 a אנא נסיב בַּנַּרְיָיתֵיה I will carry his bathing clothes (i.e. I will be his servant; cmp. B. Mets. 41 a; Erub. 27 b; Snh. 62 b).
, Y. Kil. IX, 32 b top, v. דַּרְדֵּסִין
, pl. of בְּרַתָּא.
, v. בַּיִן, בֵּין.
, Y. Snh. VII, 25 d, v. נְתִיקָה ch.
, v. בסי
, Pesik. R. suppl. (p. 197 a ed. Fr.), v. הַסְטָא
, Num. R. s. 10, v. סְבַסְטִי
a mnemotechnical device, representing ב̇המה, חס̇רון, ג̇לודה and חר̇ותא. Ḥull. 42 ab

sense.definition: , Lam. R. to III, 7 ב' של ערבייא (Yalk. a. l. גנד (גונדא) של ערביים) prob. to be read: הֶסְגֵּר the locking up of Jerusalem by the Arabs, v. ib.
sense.notes: to I, 5.—[For קסטרא של פרסיים ibid., read רוֹמִיִּים.]
— Pl. בְּסוּמֵי. Erub. 82 b; Meg. 7 b רווחא לב' וכ' Ms. M. (ed. sing., Var. in ed. בסימא, בסימה) for delicacies there is always room (appetite). V. בָּשׂוּם.
, read בָּסִיס.
, v. בְּשׂו'

sense.definition: , pl. בְּסוֹרוֹת (בסר) first-ripe fruits, first priestly gifts.
sense.notes: Keth. 16 b כוס של ב' Ar. (ed. בשורה), expl. כוס יין של תרומה. Y. ib. II, 26 b top חבית של בסורות (ed. Krot. בשורות).
Num. R. s. 7 כלים וב'. [Prob. our w. was a gloss to כלים.]

sense.definition: (v. בסס) to trample upon ; hence (with ב־) to despise ; v. בְּזֵי I; cmp. בְּטַשׁ.
same. Y. Ter. VIII, end, 46 same.
sense.notes: Y. Ter. VIII, end, 46 c לא מבסי לא ברומי וכ' (read תְבַסֵּי) despise neither a Roman of low standing &c.; (Gen. R. s. 63 לא תבזון).—

Gen. R. s. 79, end, heard an Arab say to his neighbor מה את מְבַסֵּה בי וכ' (some ed. מכ', corr. acc.) why art thou driving me? and he meant to say מה את מְעַשֶּׂה בי (Var. מְעַסֶּה) why wilt thou force me?—from which they learned the meaning of ועסותם, Mal. III, 21.

sense.definition: (v. preced.; = h. פְּשִׁיעָה) indifference, willful negligence.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Ex. XXII, 8 בכו' (corr. acc.). Y. B. Mets. V, 10 b bot. מתה בב' if the animal died through negligence; Tosef. ib. V, 10 בבוסיא ed. Zuck. (Var. בכ'). B. Kam. 116 b בבו' וכ' (Var. בכ'; Ms. M. בבִיסְיָא, בבו').
, v. פסיג'
, read בָּסִילְיוֹס.
(βασιλέως, Genit. of βασιλεύς); v. בָּסִילְיוֹס. Y. R. Hash. I, 57 a bot., v. אַגְרָפוֹס.
Y. Snh. II, 20 c מלכא יתיב על ב' דידיה וכ' (read בי ב') the King sits in his palace, and thou sayest thou art the King?

sense.definition: (genit. of βασίλεια, τὰ) of the palace, or of the royal affairs.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 93 פטרון ב' (πάτρων τῶν βασιλείων) superintendent of &c.
Y. Ber. IX, 12 d bot.; Gen. R. s. 8 (corr. acc.).

sense.definition: (βασιλική, sub. στοά) basilica, a building with colonnades for holding courts, also meeting place for merchants, exchange, forum.
sense.notes: Yoma 25 a כמין ב' גדולה was built in the style of a large basilica (semicircular). Tosef. Succ. IV, 6 (describing the Alexandrian Synagogue); Succ. 51 b. Gen. R. s. 68 עולים לב' וכ' one goes up to the basil. and finds the King holding court. Ex. R. s. 15; Tanḥ. Ḥaye 3 שמא אצל ב' וכ' perhaps he wanted me to wait for him near the basilica (on the forum). Esth. R. to I, 3. Toh. VI, 8; Tosef. ib. VII, 12; a. fr. [Y. B. Bath. IV, 14 c bot. בסלקי, v. כַּלְכּוֹס.]— Pl. בָּסִילְקָאוֹת. Ab. Zar. 16 b שלש ב' הן וכ' there are three kinds of basilicas, for Kings (holding court), for baths, and royal treasuries (τὸ βασιλικόν, sub. ταμεῖον, S.). Tosef. Ohol. XVIII, 18 selling wheat בב' שלהן in their (the gentiles’) exchanges. [Lev. R. s. 34 בסלקי, read בפִילָקִי.]
, v. בְּסַם

sense.definition: (Var. בְּסִים, בַּסִּים, בַּסִּימָא) sweet, pleasant, well-seasoned &c. (= h. ערב).
sense.notes: Targ. Ps. CXLI, 2 (h. text ערב, translated in both senses); a. fr.—Keth. 104 a top דמדליא וב' אוירא which lies high and whose air is pleasant (temperate). R. Hash. 21 a ב' תבשילא וכ' (Ms. M. 2 margin כמה ב'; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 80) how well tastes the food of the Babylonians on the day when in Palestine they observe the Day of Atonement! B. Mets. 60 a לא הוה ב' (the wine) was not good. Ib. 69 b דאיכא דב' וכ' that there is good and bad wine. Ber. 56 a ב' חמרך thy wine will be good.— Pl. בְּסִימִין, fem. בְּסִימָן, בְּסִימָתָא (also as nouns, as h. נעימים, נעימית). Targ. Y. Num. XXXIII, 28 sq.; a. e.—V. בַּסִּימַיָּא.

Y. Maas. Sh. IV, 55 c top חמרא … מיפוק בסים this man’s (thy) wine shall turn sour (ferment); v. בַּסִּין. Lam. R. to I, 1 (חד מאתינס 7) וחד דבסים and one bag with sour wine. Ib. דבסימא תסיס the dripping of the sour wine bubbles. Ib. (חד כותאי) ונפיק כוליה בסים and it will all turn sour.

sense.definition: fermenting wine, wine turned into vinegar.
sense.notes: Lam. R. to III, 40 אין דעולית' מרירן בסימא חמיע Ar. (ed. אית כרנבי ב' דסימא חמיע; read אין דכר', strike out דסימא) when the endive (the cabbage) is bitter, the fermenting wine turns sour (sin begets sin). Cant. R. end, if the vineyard is cut before its time, אפי' בִסְמֵיה וכ' even its vinegar is not good.

f. same. Y. Pes. III, beg. 29 d formerly … the wine (in Judæa) never turned sour, and they put in barley to make it sour, whence it was called ב' דרומיא Southern vinegar (fermentation, = h. חומץ האדומי).
Targ. Ps. XXVII, 4; a. e.
Targ. Y. Gen. L, 3.
את מינסב חסין וצבע בב' thou wilt take lettuce and dip in vinegar. [Prob. בסים.]
, v. בְּסַס

sense.definition: (בוס, בסס; formed like עָצִיץ) anything to tread upon; footstool, stand, base (= b. h. כַּן, מְכוֹנָה).
sense.notes: Kel. XI, 7 הפרח והב' the bud (receptacle of the candlestick) and the stand. Lev. R. s. 25; Cant. R. to V, 15 like a column which has ב' מלמטן וכ' a base beneath &c.; Tanḥ. B’har 1. Y. Ab. Zar. III, 42 d top בשאין עליהן ב' when there is upon them (the idolatrous emblems) no stand (indicating that they were intended for practical use). Ib. כוס בסוס לדרקון וכ' (corr. acc.) if the cup serves as a stand for the dragon (idolatrous emblem), it (the cup) is forbidden; a. fr.—Trnsf. (in Sabbath law) whatever is subservient to another object, e.g. the case in which a book is kept, the table upon which a lamp is placed. Sabb. 117 a ב' לדבר האסור subservient to an object which must not be handled on the Sabbath; a. fr.—V. בְּסִיסַי, בְּסִיסִית.

Targ. I Kings VII, 30; a. fr.—Y. Sabb. XVII, 16 b top ב' דידיה its (the delphica’s) pedestal. Y. Succ. V, 55 b bot. whatever (structure) stands isolated being one hundred feet high בעי ב' וכ' requires a buttress (in the shape of an ascent) of thirty three cubits on each side.— Pl. בְּסִיסַיָּא. Targ. I Kings VII, 27; a. e.

sense.definition: (= בָּסִיס; בסס) foot-stool, base, stand, step.
sense.notes: — Pl. בְּסִיסָאוֹת Ar., בְּסִיסִיּוֹת, בְּסָסִיּוֹת. Kel. XXIV, 6 שלש בְּסָ' הן (Ar. בסי') there are three stands, one before the bed (step) &c. Num. R. s. 10, beg. בסיסיות, v. בָּסִיס.
Targ. Ps. XV, 4; a. fr.— Pl. בְּסִירִין, fem. בְּסִירָן. Targ. Mal. II, 9; I, 12. Targ. Jud. IX, 4, v. בַּקָּרָא II.
Targ. Ps. CXXIII, 3.
, v. בָּסִילְקִי

sense.definition: (√בס, בש, cmp. בָּשַׁל, to boil, ripen, be warm, ferment) to be sweet, pleasant, pleasing.
sense.notes: Lam. R. to I, 9 יערב לך ויִבְסַם לך may (the sacrifice) be sweet unto thee (Moloch), may it be pleasing unto thee. Gen. R. s. 85 יערב לכם יבושם וכ' (Yalk. Gen. 144, Josh. 35 יבסם) may (the wine you drank) be sweet to you, may it well agree with you.—Denom. בּוֹסֶם.

sense.definition: , בִּישֵּׂם to make a person look well, esp. (denom. of בּוֹסֶם) to perfume with oil &c. Ex. R. s. 23 a bride מקשטין אותה ומְבַסְּמִין אותה is adorned and made handsome (her toilet is attended to).
sense.notes: —Part. pass. מְבוּסָּם, f. מְבוּסֶּמֶת, מְבוּשּׂ' perfumed, sweet &c. Num. R. s. 20 מקושטת ומב' in full toilet. Tosef. Ber. VI (V), 5 it is not becoming for a scholar שיצא מבוסם to go out with perfumed oil on his head; Ber. 43 b מבוש'. B. Bath. VI, 3 יין מב' sweet wine (guaranteed as not sour). [Pesik. R. s. 21 בישם העולם; Ruth. R. beg. ביסם, read בִּיסֵּס, v. בָּסַס.]

sense.definition: to perfume one’s self with oil &c. Gen. R. s. 17.
sense.notes: &c. Gen. R. s. 17.

sense.definition: to become exhilarated, to feel the wine.
sense.notes: Koh. R. to XI, 9 אכל ושתה ונת' he ate and drank and felt well.
Gen. R. s. 67, end נִתְבַּסְּמָה דעתו עליו his character grew better (play on בשמת Gen. XXVI, 34).—[Ib. s. 66 נתבשם העולם, v. בָּסַס.]
Targ. Ex. XV, 25; a. fr.— Part. pass. בְּסִים, v. בָּסִים.

sense.definition: to sweeten, season ; trnsf. to make happy, to delight.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Num. XVIII, 19. Targ. Ps. CXIX, 122; a. e.—Succ. 51 a; Arakh. 11 a לבַסּוּמֵי קלא to sweeten the sound (by means of instrumental accompaniment).
Targ. Y. Gen. L, 2; 26.—Part. pass. מְבַסַּם. Targ. O. XXX, 25.
Targ. Job XXIV, 20. Targ. Y. Ex. XXX, 25 מִתְבַּשֵּׂם; a. e.
. Targ. Y. Gen. L, 3.

sense.definition: to be cheerful, feel the wine; cmp. בְּלוּזְמָא.
sense.notes: Snh. 38 a כיון דאִיבְּסוּם when they were feeling the wine. Sabb. 66 b. B. Bath. 73 b bot.—Meg. 7 b מיחייב אינש לִבְּסוּמֵי וכ' (= לאיבסומי, v. Rashi a. l.) one must cheer himself up with wine &c. Ib. איבסום they were feeling the wine (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note). [Targ. Cant. II, 5 אתבסם, v. בְּסַס.]

sense.definition: (preced.) dealer in, or manufacturer of, spices, perfumes &c.; druggist.
sense.notes: Kidd. 82 b. Tosef. ib. II, 2; 4. Y. Ber. IX, 13 c bot. B. Mets. 56 b if one sells his (cancelled) notes לב' to a druggist (for wrapping paper); a. fr.—[Tosef. Ber. VI (V), 8 ed. Zuck. בושם.]— Pl. בַּסָּמִים, בַּסָּמִין, בַּשָּׂ'. Sabb. 81 a
, v. בְּסִימָא

sense.definition:
(sec. r. of b. h.
בּוּס) to tread, stamp, pile up.
sense.notes: Ukts. I, 5 stalks of eatable plants (straw &c.) שבְּסָסָן בגרן which the owner packed in the barn; Succ. 14 a מאי בססן what does this b’sasan mean? R. … says ב' ממש he really stamped them (threshed); R. … says התיר אגדן he untied them (for the purpose of piling the stalks closer by treading upon them). [Pesik. Haḥod. p. 45 a; Pesik. R. s. 15 היו בוססות, read with Num. R. s. 11 כּוֹסְסוֹת, v. כָּסַס.]

sense.definition: (denom. of בָּסִיס) to establish firmly, to found, to put on a secure basis.
sense.notes: Cant. R. to I, 9 ומי ב' העולם and who gave the world a firm basis?; (ibid. VII, 1; Ruth. R. beg.; Pesik. R. s. 21 ביסם, בישם corr. acc.).—Part. pass. מְבוּסָּס firmly established. Num. R. s. 15; Tanḥ. B’haal. 11 כסאו מב' למעלן (not מבוסם) His throne is firmly established above, when Israel &c.

sense.definition: to be firmly established, to rest safely.
sense.notes: Num. R. s. 12 after the Sanctuary was erected נתב' העולם the world became firm. Ib. as soon as they made a third leg for the table (v. טרסקל), נתב' it stood firm; Tanḥ. T’rum. 9. Gen. R. s. 66 נתבשם העולם (corr. acc.); Yalk. Ps. 811.
Part. pass. בְּסִיס based, firm. Targ. Cant. V, 15.
as preced. Pi. Targ. II Chr. III, 3.
as preced. Nithpa. Targ. Cant. II, 5 (not אתבסם).
, v. בְּסִיסִית

sense.definition: (√בס, v. בסס) to tread upon ; trnsf. (v. בעט) to contemn (with על); to be overbearing (with ב).
sense.notes: Ex. R. s. 42, end כך היתה בוֹסֶרֶת עלי so did she slight me. Ib. s. 3 beg.; s. 45 בּוֹסֵר הוא על וכ' he will treat his prophetic mission lightly. Tanḥ. Ekeb 1 בָּסַרְתִּי בהן have I become overbearing because I observed thy commands? (Tanḥ. ed. Bub. 2 כפרתי, v. note a. l.). Ib. Mikkets 10 לא תהא בוסר בשעת וכ' be not haughty in happiness, so as to refuse to pray. Ib. (ed. Bub.) Emor 29 בוסר עליהן; Tanḥ. ib. 20 (some ed. בוחר, corr. acc.) thinks lightly of them.—Part. pass. בָּסוּר, fem. בְּסוּרָה contemptible. Tanḥ. Sh’moth 11.
same. Ex. R. s. 1 וב' עליה (some ed. וכופר) and he despised it (idolatry). Tanḥ. Ekeb 1 some ed. ביסרתי, v. supra.
Targ. Ps. LXIX, 34; a. fr.

same. Targ. O. Num. XV, 31 ed. Berl.; a. fr.; [in ed. sometimes בשר].—Targ. I Sam. XI, 12 מבסר למימר spoke sneeringly.—Y. Ber. II, 5 c bot. בר נש דאימיה מְבַסְּרָא ליה one whom his mother (Palestine) despises and his stepmother (Babylon) honors; v. אֵם. Y. Snh. I, 19 a top; Y. Ned. VI, 40 a בעא מבסרתהון (מבסרתון; read מבסר בהון) he wanted to despise them (reject their authority).

sense.definition: (√בס, v. בסם) to begin to boil, to be in the first stage of ripening ; v. next w.—Denom.
sense.notes: בּוֹסֶר, בְּסוֹרָה.—Trnsf. (v. בָּשַׂר) to be glad. Gen. R. s. 34 end (play on לב בשר, Ezek. XXXVI, 26), [read as] Yalk. Gen. 61 לב בוסר בחלקו של חבירו a heart rejoicing in the good fortune of his neighbor.—V. בָּשַׂר.

sense.definition: Part. בְּסִיר m., בְּסִירָא f., pl. בְּסִירָן in the early stage of ripening.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Ex. IX, 34 סערייא … בסירן Ar. (ed. סרתא … כסידא, כסירא, read בסירא; h. text אביב).
, Pesik. Baḥod. p. 154 b, read קיסרייא.
Targ. Job XII, 21; a. e.

sense.definition: (read בִּסְטַ') m. (vestiarius, βεστιάριος S.) the keeper of the ( royal) wardrobe.
sense.notes: Pesik. R. s. 10.
עסקא = עזקא, Nöld. Mand. Gr. p. 62; Syr. ביסתא = ביזתא, P. Sm. 520) jug, pitcher; cmp. בָּזָךְ. Ḥull. 49 b
, v. בִּיסְ'
, v. בעי
, v. בַּעֲתָא

sense.definition: (v. next w.) casting bubbles, bulging, bulge.
sense.notes: Mikv. X, 4 (of garments dipped in water until they are soaked through) וינוחו מבִּעְבּוּעָן and cease from bulging. T’bul Yom II, 8 ב' שבחבית (an imperfection in an earthen jug) a protuberance

sense.definition: to cast bubbles, to form protuberances, to bulge.
sense.notes: Mikv. X, 4 עד שיְבַעְבְּעוּ until they (the garments dipped in water) form bulges; v. preced. Yalk. Sam. 157; Midr. Till. to Ps. XVIII, 3 (read:) שהיה שמן המשחה מְבַעְבֵּעַ ויורד עליו the oil of anointment came bubbling down upon him.

sense.definition: to struggle in the water, swim.
sense.notes: Y. Sabb. XIII, 14 b top.; Y. Sot. III, 19 a top. תינוק מב' וכ' a child struggling in the river. Y. Yoma III, 41 a התחיל מב' וכ' commenced casting up bubbles from under the ship (Bab. ib. 38 a מבצבצת).

sense.definition: (v. בעי) to ask entrance, knock at the door.
sense.notes: Lev. R. s. 21; Pesik. Aḥare, p. 177 a הוה מבעבע used to knock. [Ar. reads כעכע, quoting Lev. R. l. c. also for a Hebrew verb לכעכע; Rashb. to Pes. 112 a quotes נענע.]
Imper. IV אַבְעִד. Cant. R. to IV, 1 (ref. to מבעד ib.) ל' ערבי וכ' it is Arabic; if one desires to say to one, Make room for me (or, Let me alone), he says אבעד לי (some ed. מבעד).
, v. בעי
Targ. Jer. VII, 16. Targ. II Sam. VII, 20; a. fr.—בְּבָעוּ (in prayer) I pray (h. בִּי, נָא). Targ. Gen. XIX, 7. Ib. XLIV, 18; a. v. fr. [Targ. Ps. XLIII, 4, v. בּוּעֲתָא II.]
, v. עוֹד
Targ. Is. X, 33; Targ. Joel IV, 13 (ed. בָּעוּט); Targ. Is. LXIII, 3 בִּיעוּט.
Y. Taan. IV, 68 d bot. יהב ליה חד ב' וכ' he gave him one kick and killed him; Lam. R. to II, 2 חד בעיטא ברגליה.
Targ. O. Gen. XV, 17 (Y. מבעיר); a. e.— Pl. בָּעוּרִין, בְּעוּרַיָּא. Targ. Nah. II, 5 בְּעוּ' (ed. Vien.). Targ. Job XLI, 11; a. e.—B. Mets. 85 b ב' דאשא (Ms. M. דנור).
Midd. III, 8 שלא יִבְעֲטוּ marg. vers. (or יִבָּעֲטוּ Nif.; text יבעט sing.) that the walls should not bulge.

Y. Yoma VIII, 45 b top בְּעָטָתוֹ פרדה a mule kicked him. Ex. R. s. 30 ב' בפילקי knocked against the prison door (burst it open). Ab. Zar. IV, 8 גת בְּעוּטָה a wine press packed with stamped grapes.—Trnsf. (with ב) to resist, reject. Sabb. 104 a, v. אח"ס.

B. Kam. II, 1. היתה מְבָעֶטֶת if the animal kicked. Ber. 32 a; a. e.—Trnsf. to kick against, rebel, be contumacious. Sot. 22 a. Y. Ber. IX, 14 b bot., a. e. מְבָעֵט בייסורין bearing suffering with contumacy (instead of showing repentance). Pesik. R. s. 47; Yalk. Job 908 התחיל מב' (sub. בייסורין) began to be contumacious (challenging the Lord).
Targ. Hos. IV, 16; a. e.—Y. Sabb. VII, 11 a bot.; Y. Shek. III, 47 c ב' ביה rejected his authority.
Targ. Lam. I, 15.
Targ. Joel IV, 13; Targ. Is. LXIII, 3; a. e.
B. Mets. 80 a; Tosef. B. Bath. IV, 6.

entry.language-reference: √בע, akin to בה, בו, v. בו

sense.definition: א, a) to enter into, split ; b) to be empty, bare).
sense.notes: Part. בּוֹעֶה, v. infra.

sense.definition: to lay bare, destroy the crop.
sense.notes: B. Kam. I, 1 המַבְעֶה damaging the crop (ref. to Ex. XXII, 4). Ib. 3 b Rab says מבעה זה אדם the damaging force in the Mishnah means that of a human being (ransacking, searching); for we read (Is. XXI, 12) אם תבעיון בעיו if ye desire to enter &c. (where בעה refers to human action); Samuel says, מבעה זה השן the mabeh of the Mishnah refers to the tooth, i.e. to an animal’s eating up the crop, for it says (Obad. 6) נבעו מצפניו its hidden treasures were laid bare (made empty,—which refers to eating up). Ib. (argument against Samuel) מי קתני נִבְעָה the Mishnah does not use the Nifal (which may mean eaten up); (argument against Rab) מי קתני בּוֹעֶה the Mishnah does not use the Kal (which may refer to human action) but the Hifil “to cause damage”—through the animal.—Tosef. ib. IX, 1.

Targ. Jud. VI, 29 (h. text בקש); a. fr.—Ber. 2 b ובעו לה מבעיא האי וכ' and put it as a question (not as an argument), Does this uba hash-shemesh mean &c.? (opposed to preceding וממאי דהאי וכ' how can it be proven that &c.). Y. Ḥall. I, 57 b רבנן … בעיין the Rabbis of … asked. B. Kam. 33 a בעא … מרב וכ' R. asked R. N.; a. v. fr.
ב' רחמין to ask for mercy, pray. Targ. Y. Num. XII, 13; a. fr.—Ber. 8 a לבעי אינש רחמי man should pray &c., v. זיבולא. Ib. 10 a בְּעִי רחמי עלויהו וכ' pray thou for them that they may repent; a. fr.

sense.definition: to ask, want, desire; to require.
sense.notes: Targ. Ex. II, 15; a. fr.—Pes. 9 a ובָעֵי בדיקה and it (the house) requires searching over again. Keth. 39 b לא בעינא לך I do not want thee. B. Kam. 102 b לא יקרייכו בעינא וכ' I want neither your honor nor your disrespect; a. fr.—Pes. 2 a בעו שבוחי must give praise.—אי בעית אימא, usu. איבעית אימא, v. אִיבָּעִית. [Y. Yeb. XII, 13 a top בְּעֵא תתן לנו, please, give us.]

sense.definition: (ellipt.) to beg leave to say; to remark, assert.
sense.notes: Y. Ber. I, 2 b top. Y. Peah II, beg. 16 d; a. fr.

sense.definition: to be searched for, to be wanted.
sense.notes: . Targ. Jer. L, 20; a. fr.
Targ. I Sam. XXIII, 26. Targ. II Sam. IV, 4 בְּאִתְבָּעֲיוּתָהּ when she was hurried; v. בְּעַע.
Pes. 4 b, a. v. fr. אִיבָּעְיָא להו it was asked by them (the scholars), i.e. the argument came up.

sense.definition: to be required; it ought to.
sense.notes: Ib. 7 b יצא בו מיבעי ליה it ought to read yatsa bo (he has done his duty). Ib. 15 a מדבריו מ' ליה it ought to be midd’barav (not middibrehem); a. fr.—B. Kam. 21 b א' ליה לאסוקי דעתא he ought to have borne in mind; a. fr.—לא מיבעיא there is no question. לא מ' … אלא אפילו there is no question as to …, but even …; not only … but. Pes. 4 b לא מ' באתרא … אלא וכ' not only in a place where they pay no wages for searching, but do it themselves, (is there no cause for withdrawing from the agreement,) because a man likes to perform a religious duty: but even in a place where they pay wages, (there is no cause &c.,) for a man likes &c. B. Kam. 54 b לא מ' קאמר לא מ' שור וכ' the Mishnah states a case of ‘not only’; not only for an ox … is he responsible, but even &c.; a. v. fr.—מִיבָּעְיָא is there any question? ; v. הַשְׁתָּא.

sense.definition: to let burst forth, v. יְעָא a. נְבַע.
(v. בעי, בָּעָה) to open wide (the mouth), to yawn (of leopards).
sense.notes: Targ. II Esth. I, 2 נמרין בעיין.
Constr. בְּעֵי. ב' לבא greed. Targ. Prov. XXI, 4 (h. text רחב לב).
Pl. בַּעְיֵי. Snh. 106 b ד' מאות ב' four hundred questions. Ib. רבותא למבעי ב' is there any greatness in asking questions?

sense.definition: (מעין) pr. n. m. Baya (Mayan), name of a publican.
sense.notes: Snh. 44 b ב' מוכסא (not מיכ'); Y. Ḥag. II, 77 d מ' מיכס.
Y. Taan. I, 64 b bot. אנא ב' וכ' I want to see what I can do to relieve him.— Pl. m. בָּעְיֵי. Ib. a top אימת דאתון בעיי הוא בָעֵי whenever ye are desirous (that he should come), he is willing to.
, v. בֵּיעָא
, v. בְּעַט
, v. בְּעֹוט
Y. B. Kam. I, beg. 2 a (of animals). Bab. ib. 27 b לב' חמש for kicking with one’s foot &c.

Men. VI, 5 (76 a) שיפה וב' בחטין rubbing and beating refer to the preparation of the wheat of the meat-offering (prior to grinding); R. Y. says בבצק (Mish. אף incorr.) beating refers to the dough. Ib. Gem. Var. שיפה בחיטים וב' בבצק; Tosef. ib. VIII, 14.
, v. בְּעַל a. בַּעֲלָא.

Keth. 3 a שויוה רבנן לבְעִילָתוֹ בְּעִילַת זנות the Rabbis (in this case) have declared his coition (by which he wanted to establish marriage), a mere act of prostitution (annulled his marriage). Ib. 73 a, a. e. אין אדם עושה בעילתו בעילת זנות the presumption is that nobody wants to make his intercourse with a woman one of prostitution (but wants to make her his wife thereby).—Ib. 4 a בעילת מצוה the marital duty, i.e. first coition; frequ. ב' ראשונה. Y. Macc. II, 31 d; a. fr.— Pl. בְּעִילוֹת. Sabb. 72 a; a. fr.
m., v. בַּעֲצָא

sense.definition: (part. pass. of a verb בעץ, denom. of בעצא) tinned, wrapt in tin-foil.
sense.notes: Targ. Jer. XXXII, 11 (a. 14, in some ed.) כתיב ב' וחתים written, wrapt in tinfoil and tied up (v. חתם) with a seal, opp. to שטרא פתיחא.
, v. בְּעַר

sense.definition: c. (b. h. בְּעִיר; בער; cmp. also בָּעָה) grazing animal, cattle.
sense.notes: Targ. Gen. I, 24 sq.; a. fr.—Y. B. Mets. II, 8 c bot.; Lev. R. s. 27, a. e. ב' דקיקא small cattle ; v. בְּהֵמָה.—Pesik. B’shall. p. 93 a אתקן לי ב' get an animal ready for me (for travel). Snh. 105 a (in Hebr. dict., play on בְּעוֹר).
, v. בְּעֵת

sense.definition: , v. בָּעָה, to enter into, take possession) [in b. h. to be master, protect;] to have sexual intercourse (both legal or illicit), to embrace a woman.
sense.notes: Kidd. 9 b וּבְעָלָהּ מלמד וכ' ‘and he embraced her’ (Deut. XXIV,

sense.definition: , this intimates that woman can be acquired as wife by intercourse, v. בִּיאָה.
sense.notes: —בּוֹעֵל lover, adulterer, contrad. to בַּעַל husband. Sot. V, 1, a. fr. כשם שאסורה לַבַּעַל … לַבּוֹעֵל as well as the woman suspected of adultery is forbidden to her husband (who must separate himself from her), so is she forbidden to the lover (who cannot marry her after leaving her husband). Yeb. 103 a שבע בעילות ב' וכ' that wicked man had seven sexual connections &c.; a. fr.—Part. pass. f. בְּעוּלָה one no longer a virgin, opp. to בתולה; married woman, opp. to ארוסה, v. אָרַס. Keth. 10 b; a. fr.— Pl. בְּעוּלוֹת. Y. Kidd. I, 58 b bot.; a. fr.

Keth. 5 a נישאת … ונִבְעֶלֶת וכ' is married on the fourth day and embraced in the night of the fifth day of the week. Ib. 3 b תִּיבָּעֵל לטפסר וכ' must first be surrendered to the (Roman) officer (jus primæ noctis); a. fr.—Masc. נִבְעַל (of the hermaphrodite). Tosef. Bicc. II, 5; Y. Yeb. VIII, 9 d bot.
Targ. O. Deut. XXI, 13; a. fr.—Keth. 6 b דבעי למִיבְעַל because he is anxious to perform his marital duty. Ib. דטריד דלא בעיל he is excited because he has not &c.; a. fr.
f. מְבַעֲלָא married, having had intercourse. Targ. Ruth I, 12; a. e.
as preced. Nif. Yoma 19 b ואִבְּעוּל כמה וכ', (Ms. M. ואיבעיל) and how many virgins have been seduced (to-day) in Nahardea!
Kidd. I, 1 and she becomes her own master בגט ובמיתת הב' through a letter of divorce or on the husband’s death; a. v. fr.
Y. Ab. Zar. III, 43 a bot. ב' ראש גוייה הוה וכ' the Baal was the phallus and had the shape of a bean [read וכאפון].

sense.definition: [ the fructifier,] rain (v. Taan. 6 b; cmp. Is. LV, 10).
sense.notes: בֵּית בַּ' a field sufficiently watered by rain and requiring no artificial irrigation. Tosef. M. Kat. I, 1 שדה (בית) הב'. B. Bath. III, 1. Tosef. Succ. II, 7 ערבה של ב' (sub. בית) a willow in a naturally watered field. Ib. Shebi. II, 4 בשל ב' (= בשדה של ב'), opp. של שוקי. Num. R. s. 16 the Egyptian gods של שקר הם (read שקי) are gods of artificial drainage, but those of Canaan של ב' הם are gods of rain; (Tanḥ. Sh’laḥ 13, through misunderstanding, שקר … בעליכח.

sense.definition: (mostly in compounds) owner of, master of, possessed of, given to &c.; e.g. ב' אבידה owner of a lost object; ב' אגדה master of Agadah, lecturer; ב' דין opponent in court; v. infra.
sense.notes: Pes. 86 b ב' השם אני I am so named.— Pl. בְּעָלִים, בְּעָלִין owners ; mostly as sing. owner. B. Mets. VIII, 1; a. fr. [Y. Dem. III, 23 b bot. לבלעין, read לבעלין.]

Snh. 19 b.—Ib. בעלי מ' those entertaining considerations (of fear), hesitating to do justice.—ב' שיבה gray-haired. Ned. III, 8.—ב' תשובה repentant sinner. Succ. 53 a; a. fr.—ב' תשובות a man of many objections or excuses. Gen. R. s. 20 beg.—[For other compounds, not self-evident, see the respective determinants.]
בְּעֵיל, בְּעַל ch. same.
Targ. O. Ex. XXI, 3; a. fr.—Taan. 6 b מטרא ב' וכ' the rain is the husband (fructifier) of the field; v. preced. 3).
Targ. Jud. VI, 25; a. e.— Pl. בַּעֲלַיָּא. Ib. II, 11; a. fr.

sense.definition: (preced.) mistress, owner &c. Gen. R. s. 52 (rendering בְּעֻלַת, Gen. XX, 3, as though בּעֲלַת) מרתא דבעלה her husband’s mistress.
sense.notes: —Compounds are mostly self-evident, e.g. בעלת הגט the woman receiving the letter of divorce;—ב' איברים an animal of large build. Ber. 32 a; v. בַּעַל.

sense.definition: (v. בָּעָה; cmp. בהל) to be excited.
sense.notes: —Af. אַבַּע to hurry. Targ. I Kings XXII, 9 א' מיכיה Ar. (ed. תבע, h. text מהרה) bring … quickly. Targ. Ezek. XXIV, 5.—Part. pass. מַבַּע, (מִבְ') מַבְּעָא quick. Targ. Deut. XXXII, 35.— Pl. מַבְּעִין. Targ. Num. XXXII, 17.

sense.definition: to be in a hurry, be anxious.
sense.notes: Targ. Ps. XXXI, 23 באִתַּבָּעוּתִי Ms. (ed. באִתְבָּעוּתִי). Targ. II Kings VII, 15; Targ. II Sam. IV, 4, v. בְּעֵי I.
Targ. Ps. XCI, 13 תבעוץ some ed. (oth. תבעוט).

sense.definition: to wrap in tin, v. בְּעִיץ.
(cmp. בּוּץ, v. עבץ a. אבצא) tin, plumbum album.
sense.notes: Kel. XXX, 3 עשאו בין בב' if he mended it either with &c. B. Bath. 89 b (diff. fr. אבר, a. גיסטרא, cassiterum, v. Sm. Ant. s. v. Plumbum). Men. 28 b; a. fr.
Targ. Ezek. XXII, 18. Targ. Y. Num. XXXI, 22 Ar. a. Levita (ed. קסיטרא, O. אבצא).

sense.definition: , v. בָּעָה; cmp. בָּאֵר) [ to clear,]

sense.notes: Ex. R. s. 2 אש בּוֹעֶרֶת burning fire. Ib. כשם שהסנה בּוֹעֵר וכ' as the bush is burning &c. [Num. R. s. 9, end לבוערים בע"ז, read לבוסרים, v. בָּסַר I, Var. לכיפרים.]
Denom. בַּעַר.
Denom. בְּעִיר.

sense.definition: to clear, remove (out of existence or out of possession).
sense.notes: Pes. 6 a זקוק לבָעֵר is bound to remove (the leaven by burning or otherwise); a. fr.—Shebi. VII, 7 חייב לב' is bound to remove (dispose of the fruits of the Sabbath year in due time). [Num. R. s. 9 (p. 230 b ed. Amst.) מבערים את העון, read with Yalk. Num. 708, Sifré Num. 11 מערערין; oth. vers. מבררין, v. בָּרַר.]
B. Kam. 2 b וּבִעֵר זו השן ‘and it clears’ (Ex. XXII, 4) this refers to injury by the tooth (animal’s eating). [

sense.definition: (b. h.) to start a fire, enkindle.
sense.notes: V. בְּעֵרָה.]

sense.definition: to start or entertain a fire, to clear a field.
sense.notes: Sabb. 20 a (ref. to לא תבערו וכ' Ex. XXXV, 3) בכל … אי אתה מַבְעִיר ‘in all your dwellings’ thou art not permitted to start a fire; v. הַבְעָרָה. B. Kam. 60 b הַבְּעֵרָה שהִבְעַרְתִּי the fire which I set (to Zion). Ib. 55 b (ref. to Ex. l. c. 5) עד דעביד כעין מבעיר only when he acts like the one setting fire (to clear the field, i.e. criminal negligence); a. e.

sense.definition: to be rekindled, to burn again.
sense.notes: Sabb. 37 ab
Targ. O. Ex. III, 2 בָּעַר ed. Berl. (oth. ed. בָּעֵר, Part). Targ. Is. LXII, 1. Targ. Ps. XVIII, 9; a. fr.
Pes. 5 b בְּעִירוּ חמירא וכ' dispose ye of the leavened bread of the (gentile) soldiers (deposited with you).
Targ. Ex. XXXV, 3. Targ. O. Lev. VI, 5 (Mss. a. some ed. יַבְעֵר Af.).
same. Targ. O. Lev. VI, 5 (v. supra). *Targ. Y. I Gen. XV, 17 מַבְעִיר שביבין.

sense.definition: (cmp. בְּעֵי II) to open the mouth wide, to low (of oxen; cmp. פער).
sense.notes: Targ. II Eth. I, 2 בוערין (some edit. געיין).

B. Kam. VI, 4 השולח את הב' ביד וכ' he who sends out a deaf and dumb, an idiot or a minor with burning materials (live coal &c.) thus causing or ordering a conflagration. Ib. השולח את הב' he who starts a fire (himself). Ib. 60 b, v. בָּעַר.

sense.definition: = בְּאַשׁ to displease (in Targ. Y. II).
sense.notes: Targ. Y. II Deut. XV, 10 (ed. Vien. באש). Ib. XXVIII, 54 תַּבְעַשׁ (read תִּבְעַשׁ); 56.
with בָּהַת q. v.) to startle. [Not used in Kal.]
Num. R. s. 18; Tanḥ. Korah 6 נזדעזע אהרן ונ' Aaron trembled and was alarmed. Y. Shek. I, beg. Bab. ed. נִבָּעֵית, v. בָּהַת.

Yoma V, 1 (52 b) שלא להַבְעִית וכ' in order not to alarm the people (by a long delay). Ib. 39 b למה אתה מבעית עצמך why wilt thou be the alarmer thyself (predicting thine own destruction; Ms. M. a. Yalk. Zech. 578 את עצמך, incorr.; Ms. Oxf. בעצמך; Y. ib. VI, 43 c bot. מבהלינו, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).
Y. Sabb. VI, 8 b top שהוא מִתְבָּעֵת for he is excited.
Nidd. 66 b משום דבעיתא because she is excited (afraid of falling down).

Targ. Ps. XVIII, 5 (Ms. בְּעֵיתַת Pe.).—Keth. 77 b דילמא מְבַעֲתַת לי lest thou frighten me. Ḥull. 53 a sq. בַּעוּתֵי קא מְבַעֲתֵי אהדדי they frighten each other. Nidd. 66 a זיל בַּעֲתָהּ go and frighten her (by a sudden noise).

sense.definition: to be afraid; to be agitated, anxious, in haste (cmp. b. h. חָרַד).
sense.notes: Targ. I Sam. XXI, 2. Targ. Is. XXII, 4. Targ. II Kings VII, 15 באִתְבְּעָתוּתְהוֹן Regia (ed. באתבעותהון); v. בְּעַע a. בְּעֵי I. Y. Ab. Zar. V, 44 d bot. והוא מתבעת and he is afraid (to touch the wine).—Meg. 3 a האי מאן דמִיבְּעִית when one is suddenly seized with fright. Ib. איבעיתו. Keth. 106 a הוה מיבעית ליה בעותי he ran anxiously to meet him; cmp. Targ. I Sam. l. c.; a. fr.
— Pl. בַּעֲתַיָּא. Targ. Ps. LXXXVIII, 17, v. בִּיעוּתָא.
Targ. Prov. XIII, 1; a. e. (h. text גערה).—Ib. XVII, 10 some ed. בָּעָאתָא.
, Y. Meg. I, 72 a top, v. כִּיפָה

sense.definition: (√בץ = בק, בע; cmp. בצע) [ to split, break through ;] (cmp. בְּעֵי I) to search, ransack.
sense.notes: Targ. Prov. II, 4 (ed. Wil. תצביה, read תבציה). Ib. XXV, 27. Ib. XX, 27 (Var. בעיא).— Part. בָּצֵי בָּאצֵי. Ib. XXV, 2.

sense.definition: , contr. אִיבְּצֵי to be searched, found out.
sense.notes: Ib. 3. Ib. XXVIII, 12 מִבְּצֵי.

Targ. Job VIII, 11 (Var. כיסנא). Targ. Ps. LXIX, 3 בוצא דמצולתא Ms. (ed. מיא).— Pl. בִּצִּין, בִּצַּיָּא, בִּי'. Targ. Is. XIV, 23. Targ. Y. II Ex. VIII, 1 (ed. Vien. בֵּיצַיָּא). Targ. Ezek. XLVII, 11.

sense.definition: (Pilp. of בוץ or בצץ; v. בְּצָא) to break through, bubble forth, burst forth.
sense.notes: Sot. 11 b; Ex. R. s. 1 היו מְבַצְבְּצִין וכ' they burst forth and came out of the ground. Keth. 111 b the righteous (dead) שמבצבצין וכ' will break through (the ground) and rise in Jerusalem.—Pes. 13 a היה חמץ מב' the leavened bread crumbled through the bag. Num. R. s. 18, end; Gitt. 56 b דם מב' ויוצא blood bubbled forth. Ḥull. 56 a אם מב' if the brains bubble through the hole in the scull.
Ḥull. 46 b אי מבצבצא if the lungs (on being put in water, or water being put on the diseased spot) cast bubbles when blown up.
, v. בֵּיצָה
Ezek. XLVII, 1

— Pl. בִּצִּים, בִּי'. Par. VIII, 10. Tosef. Mikv. I, 14. Snh. 5 b a teacher spoke of מי בֵיצִים the liquid of eggs, and the students understood בִּצִּים Ar. (Ms. F. ביצים, ed. בצעים, v. בִּצְעָה). V. בִּיצִּית.
f., pl. בְּצוֹצְטְרָאוֹת (reduplic. of בצר) = גִּיזְרָה a. גְּזוּזְטְרָא; cmp. בְּצוֹרְתָא. Y. B. Bath. III, end, 14 b (for which Tosef. ib. II, 17 גזוזטראות). V. next w.

sense.definition: (reduplic. of בצר; cmp. חצוצרה) a compartment surrounded with bars, balustrade, balcony.
sense.notes: Midd. II, 5 והקיפוה ב' וכ' and they surrounded the cell (לשכה) with a balcony so that the women could sit above, while the men were seated beneath it; [Succ. 51 b גזוזטרא, Ms. M. גזוזטראות; Tosef. ib. IV, 1 שלש גז']. [The variations כצוצרא, כצוצטרא &c., v. Rabb. D. S. to Sabb. 96 a, Erub. 78 b notes, a. Ar. s. v. גזוזטרא, are clerical errors induced by assonance with the synonymous גזוזטרא. Ἔξώστρα as balcony, for h. עליה, Symm. II Kings I, 2, is itself an adaptation of גזוזטרא.]

sense.definition: (בצר, v. preced.) engines of siege or defence (v. אָהֳלִית).
sense.notes: Pesik. Haḥod. p. 47 a; Shub. p. 163 b (for Var. Lect., v. Bub. notes a. l.); Pesik. R. s. 15. Midr. Till. to Ps. II, end שמא אהליות וב' אני צריך do I need camps and engines (for demolishing the world)?; Yalk. Ps. 623 צוצריות (corr. acc.). V. קַסְטְרִיּוֹת.

Ab. V, 8 רעב של ב' וכ' a famine in consequence of high prices, when some are hungry, others are satisfied, רעב של מהומה ושל ב' a famine through political disturbances and through dearth. Gen. R. s. 33 שנת ב' a year of dearth. Taan. III, 1 מכת ב', expl. ib. 19 b מכה המביאה לידי ב' a calamity which will produce dearth (want of rain in season).

Targ. Jer. XVII, 8 (ed. Wil. בְּצוּרְתָא); a. fr.—Taan. 19 ab נהרא אנהרא ב' וכ' when provision has to be imported on rivers (canals), it is called ב', when from one country to another it is called כפנא. Keth. 97 a.— Pl. בַּצּוֹרָתָא. Targ. Jer. XIV, 1 (some ed. בּוּצְרָתָא).
Targ. Ezek. XLI, 13 sq.; a. fr.—
, v. בֵּיצָה
, v. בִּצָּה
Peah VII, 7; a. fr.—Y. B. Bath. III, 14 a top ג' שנים … ב' וכ' three undisturbed grain crops, three grape harvests &c.; v. Bab. ib. 36 b. V. בְּצִירָה.

sense.definition: ch. m. (בצר) diminished, small ; (adv.) less, least.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Gen. I, 16; a. e.—Snh. 108 b. B. Mets. 21 b ב' מהכי less than this; a. fr.—V. בִּיצִירְתָּא.
, v. בְּצַר, end.
Sabb. 17 a בשעת הב' when they are cut; a. fr.— Pl. בְּצִירוֹת. B. Bath. 36 b עד שיבצור ג' ב', v. בָּצִיר.
, v. בְּצוּרְתָא

sense.definition: (√בץ, cmp. פצל) to peel; to split, branch off.
sense.notes: Lam. R. introd.; Koh. R. to XII, 7 (interpret. אם הדרך Ezek. XXI, 26) (אם) אמה דבצלית an arm which branches off (direction post on the cross-road).
Erub. 29 b top אי' זירתא (ed. Pesaro a. Ar. אפציל, Var. אבציל) the bulb has grown to the length of a span.

Nidd. 17 a; a. fr.—Maasr. V, 7 (8) ב' של רכפה, expl. in Y. ib. 52 a ‘the stalk of which is pressed inward’; oth. opin. ‘which has no acerbity’, v. אֶרֶס.— Pl. בְּצָלִים. Shebi. II, 9 הב' הסריסים which produce no seeds. Ib. V, 4 ב' הקיצונים summer onions; a. fr.—Ukts. II, 8 עלי ב' ובני ב' the leek-like sprouts, and the central sprouts of onions. Gen. R. s. 82 (ref. to Obad. 6) קליפת ב' (not בצליא) like peeling onions (laying bare Esau’s shame).
, v. בּוּצְלָא

sense.definition: (b. h.) Bezaleel; 1) the artificer of the Tabernacle.

sense.notes: the artificer of the Tabernacle. Ber. 55 a. Ex. R. s. 48; a. fr.
R. B., an Amora. Cant. R. to III, 11 ר' ברכיה בשם ר' ב' (Num. R. s. 12 בצלה; Pesik. Vayhi, p. 4 b לוי; Yalk. Ex. 369 only בשם ר').
, v. preced.
Y. Snh. VI, 23 c bot.; Y. Ḥag. II, 77 d bot. Miriam, the daughter of A. B. (prob. a nickname).
Kil. I, 3; v. Y. ib. 27 a. [Maim.: desert onion.]

sense.definition: to cut, break, esp. to break bread and say the blessing.
sense.notes: Ḥull. 7 b מימיו לא ב' על וכ' never said grace over a piece of bread which was not his own (never accepted an invitation). Ber. 46 a בע"הב בּוֹצֵעַ וכ' the host breaks the bread and the guest says grace after meal. Ib. 47 a אין הבוצע רשאי לִבְצוֹעַ וכ' he who is chosen to break the bread, must not begin to break until the Amen of those that respond (to the blessing) is finished; a. fr.

sense.definition: to split the difference, to adjust, compromise.
sense.notes: Snh. 6 b top נגמר … לבצוע after the legal proceedings are closed, thou must not act as an arbiter in a compromise. Ib. אסור לב' the court is forbidden to attempt a settlement (you must let the law take its course). Ib. מצוה לב' it is a meritorious act to bring about a settlement. Ib. (before having formed an opinion the judge may say) צאו ובִצְעוּ go out and settle; a. fr.
Y. Snh. I, 18 b top המְבַצֵּעַ חוטא the judge who settles a case is a sinner. Ib. לְבַצֵּעַ (interch. with לבצוע). V. בִּיצּוּעַ.
B. Bath. 91 b כד הוה ב' ינוקא וכ' when a child broke apart a piece of St. John’s bread. Sabb. 140 b, v. בִּיצּוּעָא.—
Targ. Job XXXIII, 18 יבצע Ms. (ed. ימנע).
Targ. O. Lev. II, 6 (Var. בְּצַע Pe.). [Y. Taan. IV, 69 b; Y. Meg. I, 70 a bot. מבצע (Cant. R. to I, 16 מצנעה) read: מנצב, מנצבה, v. נְצַב.]

— Pl. בִּצְעִים, בִּצְעִין, בִּי'. Tosef. Snh. III, 4 שתי בצעין ed. Zuck. (Var. ביצועין); Shebu. 16 a שני בצעים וכ' Ar. (read שתי, ed. ביצעין, Ms. M. בצעי') there were two ponds (reservoirs) in Jerusalem, the upper &c. Sabb. 31 a בין בִּצְעֵי המים between the dykes (of the Nile). Snh. 96 a בִּיצְעֵי וכ'. Ib. 5 b, v. בִּצָּה.

sense.definition: (v. בצבץ) to break through, divide; to ooze, trickle, drip.
sense.notes: Y. Pes. VII, beg. 34 a כל העצים בּוֹצְצִין משקין all other sorts of wood (used for roasting spits) will drip moisture. Y. M. Kat. I, beg. 80 a; Tosef. Mikv. I, 13 ההרים בוצצין (ed. Zuck. ביצין) the mountains are trickling (sending the rain water into the rivers; cmp. preced.).

entry.language-reference: בָּצַק, √בץ, to break open, split, v. Deut. VIII, 4; cmp. סדק a. denom.)

sense.notes: Pes. III, 2 (46 a) ב' הַחֵרֵשׁ deaf dough, i.e. having no indications of rising (which makes it doubtful whether or not fermentation has set in); [oth. reading ב' הַחֶרֶשׂ hard and smooth as a potsherd]. Ib. 4; a. fr.— Pl. בְּצֵקוֹת. Ib. 40 a
Pes. 3 b בּוֹצְרִין בטהרה one must cut grapes under the rules of levitical cleanness. Gitt. 57 a בָּצְרוּ … את כרמיהן וכ' the gentiles held vintage in vineyards soaked with Israel’s blood; a. fr.
Ex. R. s. 30, beg. עד שתגיע עונתן לִיבָּצֵר until their (the nations’) time has arrived to be cut (ripe for punishment).
Tanḥ. Noah 18 נִבְצָרִים מן וכ' cut off from the world (destroyed). Gen. R. s. 38 יִבָּצֵר מהם shall be denied them.

Part. pass. מְבוּצָּר. Y. Pes. VII, 35 b bot.; Y. Shebu. VIII, beg., 38 b גג מב' a roof surrounded with railings, v. בְּצוֹצְרָה.—Neg. I, 5 מְבוּצֶּרֶת an eruption surrounded with sound flesh; ib. X, 2 sq. מבוצר (of the hair in the flesh affected by the eruption). Deut. R. s. 1 (ref. to עיר מצור Ps. LX, 11, a. מבצר ib. CVIII, 11) עיר שמבוצרת וכ' the city (of Rome) which is well fortified &c.
Ib. שמצירה ומבצרה לישראל (Mat. K. ומְבַצֶּרֶת, Yalk. Ps. 779 מבצרא ch.) the city which troubles and diminishes Israel.

sense.definition: to be railed around, be set apart.
sense.notes: Meg. 14 a; Snh. 110 a; Num. R. s. 18 מקום נ' להם וכ' a place was set apart for them in Gehenna; Koh. R. to VII, 2.

sense.definition: (v. preced. a. next w.) to be diminished.
sense.notes: Keth. 7 b דבָצְרָה מיום אחד who has less than one day’s (celebration of marriage with benedictions at meals).

sense.definition: (neut. v.) to be cut, lessened; to be small; to want.
sense.notes: Ab. Zar. 9 a כמה בצרן (Rashi בצירן) how much is wanting yet? Targ. Prov. XIV, 28 בציר עמא the population is diminishing.—Ḥull. 42 b בצר להו חדא there is, according to him, one less (than the number stated); a. fr.
Targ. Y. Deut. XIII, 1; IV, 2 (Var. תבַצְּרוּן Pa.). Targ. Job XV, 4.—Nidd. 65 a למִבְצַר לה חדא to allow her one night less; a. fr.

sense.definition: to cut off; to diminish, deduct.
sense.notes: Men. 37 b האי מאן דבַצְּרֵיה לגלימיה he who cuts one corner of his cloak off.—Targ. Koh. III, 5. Targ. Deut. IV, 2, a. e., v. supra.—Ab. Zar. 9 b ונְבַצַּר וכ' we let him deduct therefrom forty eight. B. Mets. 103 b בַּצְּרִי לך I let thee have it for less.—Denom. בַּצִּירָא one who uses the vowel letters sparingly. Ab. Zar. 9 ab and as a mnemonical sign (for remembering when to add and when to deduct) ספרא ב' וכ' the writer of Bible copies writes many words without the vowel letters (defective) which the Mishnah teacher writes plene

sense.definition: = בָּצִיר crop, trnsf. means of support, ( family-) trade.
sense.notes: Ex. R. s. 40, end לעולם … מניח בִּצְרוֹ one should never give up his trade; Pesik. R. s. 6, end מחליף בְּצִירוֹ (Arakh. 16 אומנותו ואומנות אבותיו). Ex. R. l. c. (insert Job XXII, 24—25 as text) the Lord says, אני הוא בִצְרְכֶן … בִצְרָן וכ' I am your support, give ye never up your support (faith); but also the support of your fathers ye must not give up (labor) &c. Pesik. R. l. c. thou art our God ובְצִירֵנוּ and our support (ref. to Ps. XCV, 6).
Ex. R. l. c. (ref. to Job l. c.; cmp. Targ.) שנעשה חומותיך He will be thy fortification. [Yalk. Deut. 811, v. בִּיצּוּר.]

sense.definition: Betseth, a Phœnician border-town (perh. identical with Bassa, Neub. Géogr. p. 22).
sense.notes: Y. Dem. II, 22 d top; Tosef. Shebi. IV, 9 (Var. כצת; Hildesh. p. 34 בצץ).

sense.definition: (בקק to enter into, search, v. P. Sm. 573; cmp. בִּינָא III, בִּינִיתָא a. פִּשְׁפָּשׁ) gnat.
sense.notes: Ḥull. 58 b לית ב' בר יומא no gnat lives an entire day. Ib. תלו ליה לב' וכ' they suspended on the gnat’s proboscis sixty &c. Ib. אמראי בקת' לבקא Ar. (ed. אמרא ב' מבקא) the she-gnat quarrelled with the he-gnat, v. מרי.— Pl. בַּקֵּי. Succ. 26 a משום ב' on account of the gnats. Sabb. 77 b, v. כַּשְׁכֵּשׁ.

sense.definition: (√בק, v. preced.; cmp. בצא, a. בין; v. בקר, בקש &c.) to search, investigate, examine, find out.
sense.notes: Part. בָּקֵי. Targ. Prov. XVII, 3 צרפא בקי Bxt. (ed. נקי). Ib. XXIV, 12 בָּאקֵי Ms. (Bxt. a. oth. בצי; corrupt. באהי; h. text יבין).—B. Mets. 84 b בְּקִי באבוך וכ' (Yalk. Prov. 964 בַּקְרִי) find out what thy father is doing now. Pes. 3 b בקי מאי דיניה Ms. M. (ed. בדוק) find out his ways and manners. Gitt. 69 b ליבקי וכ' let one search for the body of one who died on a Sabbath. Koh. R. to XI, 2 (read:) עד דאינון בקיין תרין חיואן וכ' (strike out אזלון בעיין … ונפקין) while they were searching (for the grave), two serpents of fire &c.
, Y. Snh. VII, end, 25 d, read בַּקְרוּתָא.
, v. בַּקְלָסָא
, v. בַּקְרוּת
, v. בִּיקּוֹרֶת
, v. בְּקָא

Targ. I Chr. XI, 11.—Kidd. 10 b ב' בחדרי תורה well acquainted with the chambers (intricacies) of the Law; Y. Keth. V, 29 d bot. ב' בסתרי וכ'. Snh. VII, 2 שלא היה ב"ד ב' the court was not versed in the law. Yoma 49 a ב' ברפואות an expert in medicine. Yeb. 102 a כלום אתה ב' בר' וכ' art thou acquainted with R. &c.?; Tosef. ib. XII, 11 ב' היה לך בר' וכ' ed. Zuck. (read ב' הי' לך ר' as oth. ed.) was R. … well known to thee? Keth. 6 b; a. fr.— Pl. בְּקִיאִין, בְּקִיאֵי. Targ. I Chr. XII, 32 (Var. בקיעין). Ḥull. 4 a אין ב' וכ' (the Samaritans) are not so well versed in the details of the Law as &c. Gitt. 86 b. Kidd. 30 a אינהו ב' … אנן לא בְקִיאִינָן they (the ancients) were versed in Biblical orthography (in defective and plene), we are not.— Fem. בְּקִיאָה. Ḥag. 5 a. [Targ. Y. II Gen. XLIX, 12 בַּקְיִין בהלכה Ar., ed. כה', incorr., Levita in Tishbi בְּקִיאין; Y. I נקיין מן חלבא!]

sense.definition: (בקע; cmp. בִּצְעָה) fissure, ditch, esp. small pond for washing clothes.
sense.notes: M. Kat. 8 b נברכת וב', expl. as גיהא ובר גיהא a large pond and a small pond. Tosef. B. Bath. I, 2. Ib. M. Kat. I, 9 זו היא נ' … ב' Nibrekheth a. B’kia are the same; Y. ib. I, 80 d כל שהוא תושב וכ' any permanent cut in the ground is called בקיע ( fissure, a grave, wash-pond &c.). [Another opin. in Ar. ב' = אבן ב' a flat stone whereon washers beat their clothes; Y. l. c. כל שהוא וכ' any stone fixed in the ground is called a b’kia.—Ms. M. a. ed. Ven. נְקִיעַ, v. נֶקַע.]

Snh. 5 b ב' במומי (Ms. M. פקיע) an expert in judging bodily defects. B. Bath. 164 b בקיע some ed. (Ms. M. בקי, F. פקיע).— Pl. בְּקִיעִין, בְּקִיעֵי. Targ. I Chr. XII, 32 Var., v. בָּקִי. Shebu. 42 a דכמה דנפישי בקיעי טפי (some ed. בקיאי, Ms. F. פ') the majority of the experts are supposed to be better versed (than the minority).

sense.definition: (בקע) that which is demolished by chopping.
sense.notes: Lev. R. s. 19, v. אָלִיס.

definition.italic: cleaving, cleft; that which is cloven, a log.

sense.notes: Pl. בְּקִיעוֹת. Koh. R. to II, 23 בקע לי שתי ב' chop for me two logs; (Gen. R. s. 27 בקעיות, v. בְּקַעַת). Koh. R. to X, 9; Gen. R. s. 55, end בשכר שתי ב' שבקע וכ' as a reward for the two pieces of wood which Abraham chopped (Gen. XXII, 3).
Sabb. 101 a בְּקִיעַת דגים the crossing of fish under the ship.

sense.definition: B’kiin, ( K’far) P’kiin, modern Fukin, a place in Southern Palestine between Lydda and Jabneh, residence of R. Joshua.
sense.notes: Y. Ḥag. I, beg. 75 d. Snh. 32 b; a. fr.

sense.definition: (בקק; cmp. בקע, בקיעא) a broken piece, potsherd.
sense.notes: Pl. בְּקִיקִין. Targ. Y. Ex. XII, 12; Num. XXXIII, 4.
, Cant. R. to I, 12 ב' בוקינוס וכ', read קַלָּאנִין בבוק' וכ', v. קַלָּן; v. Yalk. ib. 983.

sense.definition: (בקלס, בקל with ס intens., as בלעס a. בלע; cmp. Syr.
sense.notes: בוקלא P. Sm. 474; √בק, cmp. בקעת) club, shepherd’s crook. Gen. R. s. 38 קם נסב בקלסיה (or בקלסא) he stood up, took (his) crook and broke the idols, ויהב בוקלסא וכ' and placed the crook into the hand of the largest of them (Rashi בולקסא, corr. acc.).— Pl. בַּקְלָסֵי, (בַּקּוֹלְסֵי) בּוּקְלָסֵי. Zeb. 105 a נקיטי לה בבו' Rashi (ed. בבקולסי; Ms. M. בקלסי, Ar. s. v. קלס, בקולסי, Ms. R. 1 בקינסי, Ms. K. בקונסי) they seize it (the sacrifice to be burnt) with crooks (while standing outside).

sense.definition: to split, chop; to break through.
sense.notes: B. Mets. 99 a בָּ' בו; (Kidd. 47 b בִּיקַּע) if he chopped wood with it. Gen. R. s. 55, end; Koh. R. to X, 9; II, 23, v. בְּקִיעָה. Ex. R. s. 21 אני בוֹקֵעַ להם וכ' I am going to split the sea for them; a. fr.—Lam. R. to II, 2 בקעו בחיילותיו וכ' broke through the lines of N.’s armies; Y. Taan. IV, 69 b top ברחו לתוך.

sense.definition: to cross, make a short cut, pass over.
sense.notes: Y. Pes. I, 27 b bot. חצר שהרבים בּוֹקְעִין וכ' a court which people use for crossing. Erub. 16 b; Sabb. 101 b (a low wall) שהגדיים וכ' ב' over which the kids pass; v. בִּקְעָה.

sense.definition: (cmp. בִּצְבֵּץ) to break through the ground, esp. as a legal fiction for a levitical impurity the cause of which is underground, but which affects the things above and beneath.
sense.notes: Ohol. VI, 6 טומאה בּוֹקַעַת וכ' the impurity breaks through the ground and rises, and breaks through and goes down; a. fr.—Koh. R. III, 16 היה הדם בו' ועולה the blood broke through and rose. Midr. Till. to Ps. LXXVIII, 45 ב' את הצור, ב' בצור break through (take root in) the rock; a. fr.

sense.definition: to be split, to burst open.
sense.notes: Ib. הסיפין נבקעין וכ' the door sells were burst before them. Ib. נ' הספל מאליו the vessel went to pieces of itself. Gen. R. s. 55, end זכה להִבָּקַע הים וכ' he was rewarded by the sea being divided before the children of Israel. Ḥull. 14 b שמא יִבָּקַע הנוד the wine bottle may burst; a. fr.

Kidd. 47 b, v. supra. Y. Bets. I, 60 a bot.; Y. Ab. Zar. II, 41 c bot. שביקעו (שבקעו) להם וכ' of whose flocks the wolves had torn more than &c. Bets. IV, 3 אין מְבַקְּעִין וכ' one must not split woods (on Holy Days) etc. Sifré Deut. 183 (ref. to Deut. XIX, 5) מן העץ המְבַקֵּעַ from the splitting wood (the handle), opp. העץ המִתְבַּקֵּעַ the split wood (the tree). Tanḥ. Vayetse 9 בַּקְּעִי וכ' chop thou &c.—Part. pass. מְבוּקָּע. Ab. Zar. 65 b מְבוּקָּעוֹת grapes burst open.
Sabb. 67 b המְבַקַּעַת ביצים (Rashi Var. המקבעת, Ms. M. עצים) one who squeezes egg-shells &c. (a superstitious practice; Tosef. ib. VI (VII), 18 הנותנת בצים … בכותל).
Shebi. IV, 5 המַבְקִיעַ בזתים וכ' he who cuts olive-trees down (in the Sabbath year) must not cover the stump with ground.
Y. Kil. III, 28 d top להַבְקִיעַ וכ' to plant four rows across a valley from end to end.

sense.definition: to be split; to burst, break.
sense.notes: Sifré Deut. 183, v. supra.—Sabb. XVI, 5. Cant. R. to VI, 4.

sense.definition: [ a split,] beka, a weight and a coin, equal to half a Shekel.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 84; a. e.
, v. בִּקְעֲתָא

sense.definition: cut, notch, whence valley, plane; a group of fields ; v. בָּאגִא; esp. a short cut for farm-laborers &c. Toh. VI, 7, a. e. הב' בימות החמה וכ' the path through the fields in summer-time (when used by field laborers) is considered as private ground with regard to Sabbath laws, as public with regard to levitical purity.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 61 b when one sells … a field בב' גדולה within a large group of fields (all belonging to the seller). Ib. (in a place) where they call לשדה ש' ולב' ב' a field sadeh and an estate bikah ; a. fr.—Trnsf. an unguarded field, moral danger. Erub. 6 a; 100 b; Ḥull. 110 a רב ב' מצא וכ' Rab found an unguarded field and fenced it in, i.e. found people transgressing the law in ignorance and instituted preventive regulations.— Pl. בְּקָעוֹת. Gen. R. s. 98.—2) (constr.) בִּקְעַת pr. n. pl. Valley of—, as ב' יזרעאל, ב' ידים &c., for all of which see the respective determinants.
, Y. Ned. IV, beg. 38 c, v. בִּיקּוּעַ

sense.definition: chip, piece of wood; log to be chopped.
sense.notes: B. Kam. 32 b נתזה ב' וכ' a chip slipped out (of the carpenter’s hand) and struck his face; Y. ib. III, end, 3 d. Y. Macc. II, 31 c bot. Y. Bets. IV, 62 c bot. אין מכבין את הב' you must not extinguish the log; v. כָּסַס. Sabb. 29 a top; a. fr.— Pl. (cmp. pl. of כְּנֶסֶת) בִּקְעִיּוֹת. Ḥull. 37 b אפי' אוכלת ב' even if strong enough to bite wood. Koh. R. to III, 17 (a gloss expl. גזירין). Gen. R. s. 27, v. בְּקִיעָה.
dial. for פְּקַעַת q. v.
Targ. Y. Num. XIX, 6.
Targ. Gen. XI, 2; a. fr.— Pl. בַּקְעָתָא.—Y. Shebi. III, 34 c top, v. פְּקוּעָה.—Constr. בַּקְעַת, pr. n. Valley of … Gen. R. s. 10; a. fr.

sense.definition: , v. בקע) to enter into, to clear, split ; whence

sense.notes: Denom. בָּקָר (= בְּעִיר).
Denom. בֹּקֶר.

sense.definition: to enter into, examine, search, distinguish (cmp. בִּין).
sense.notes: Keth. 106 a מְבַקְּרֵי מומין those entrusted with the examination of sacrificial animals. Y. Bets. II, 61 c top ובִיקְּרָן ממומן and had them examined (and declared free) from bodily defects. Ḥag. 9 b אין אומרים בַּקְּרוּ וכ' we do not say, Examine ye a camel, a swine &c. (i.e. only the deeds of distinguished persons are scrutinized); a. fr.— Part. pass. מְבוּקָּר examined and found fit. Y. Ber. IV, 7 b top טליים מְבוּקָּרִים lambs which passed examination.

sense.definition: to inquire after one’s health, to visit the sick.
sense.notes: Ned. IV, 4 (38 b). ונכנס לְבַקְּרוֹ and comes to see him. Snh. 68 a; a. v. fr. [Ruth. R. to II, 15, v. infra.]
נִתְבַּקֵּר
Gen. R. s. 81 פנקסו נִתְבַּקְּרָה his account is examined (his sins visited); Tanḥ. Vayishlaḥ 8 מִתְבַּקֶּרֶת. Gen. R. s. 84, read with Yalk. Gen. 141 נתב' פנקסי my account &c.
Num. R. s. 18 as all sick persons מִתְבַּקְּרִין are tended (by physicians).

sense.definition: (Y. Dial. for הִפְקִיר, v. פָּקַר; v. next w.) to give free, to resign ownership, to declare a property ownerless.
sense.notes: Y. Ned. IV, 38 d; Y. Peah V, beg. 19 b [read:] כיון שאדם מַבְקִיר דבר יצא מרשותו as soon as one declares a thing to be free, it has gone out of his control; Y. Dem. III, 23 b bot. כיון שאדם מ' … ויצא … הבקירו הבקר as soon as one gives a thing free and it has left his possession, his act is valid; a. fr. [Ruth. R. to II, 15 מבקר, מבדר, prob. מבקיר; v. בָּדַר.]

sense.definition: to be declared free, to be free.
sense.notes: Y. Peah VI, 19 c top.—Part. מוּבְקָר Ib. 19 b bot. שדי מוּבְקֶרֶת וכ' (Tosef. Maasr. III, 11. הרי … מופ') my field shall be free for one day &c.; a. e.
— Pa. בַּקַּר
. Targ. O. Lev. XIII, 36; a. fr.
Targ. Y. I Deut. XXIV, 20 (II תתב', read תבקרון, h. text תפאר).

sense.definition: to let the herd graze (cmp. בער), to drive unmuzzled animals.
sense.notes: . Targ. Y. Gen. XIII, 7.
Targ. Y. Ex. XVIII, 20; a. e.—Y. Sabb. VI, 8 c bot.; a. fr.

sense.definition: (= preced. Hif.) to abandon, leave unclaimed, declare free.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Ex. XXIII, 11 Ar. (some ed. ותפקד, read ותפקר). Y. Shebi. IX, 39 a top וַאֲבַקְּרָה קומיהון and I will declare it free goods in their presense. Ib. ומְבַקְּרִין ליה and declare ye it free property.

sense.definition: v. בָּקַר) morning, early day ; metaph.
sense.notes: light, salvation. Y. Taan. I, 64 a top ב' לצדיקים וכ' a morning for the righteous, a night for the wicked. Ruth. R. to III, 13 בַּבּ' בעולם וכ' ‘in the morning’—that means in the world which is all-good. Esth. R., introd. (ref. to Deut. XXVIII, 67) בבָקְרָהּ של בבל וכ' in the morning (ascendancy) of Babel thou shalt say, Oh that her evening (downfall) would come! Gen. R. s. 21 (ref. to Dan. VIII, 14) לִכְשֶׁיֵּעָשֶׂה בָּקְרָן וכ' when the morning of the (persecuting) nations shall become evening, and the evening of Israel morning; Tanḥ. ed. Bub. B’resh. 23. Mekh. Bo, s. 6 in order to define it: לבָקְרוֹ של ב' at the very break of morning; Y. Ber. I, 2 c top.— Pl. בְּקָרִים. Yoma 33 b חלקהו לשני ב' divide the acts prescribed into two mornings, i.e. let another act be inserted between. Ber. 27 a חלקהו לשני ב' take only one half of the morning hours. Y. Pes. V, 31 d top אית לך מימר תמן בין הַבְּקָרַיִם then it ought to have read there ben hab-b’karaim (as you read בין הערבים, Du.).

sense.definition: v. בָּקַר) a beef ; (collect.) oxen, cattle.
sense.notes: Sifra Vayikra ch. II, Par. 2 אין לך בבהמה אלא ב' וכ' under b’hemah for offerings (Lev. I, 2) are meant only beeves and sheep; a. fr. בן ב' young cattle, calf.
